loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gogarma Village. Yakubu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.

In the past, Yakubu suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to feed his children and family. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Yakubu has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 150 bags of maize this year, Yakubu can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is an enterprising married man, aged 45. He has six children, three of whom attend school. Fred lives in a rural area with his family and deals in cattle keeping as well as farming. 

He has been in business since 1990 and works 14 hours a day, seven days a week. He started the business to improve his family income and to earn school fees for the children.

Fred acquired this loan to purchase drugs for his cows and herbicides for his crops. His hope for the future is to be the leading supplier of cows and food crops in his home village. The challenge he faces is poor weather conditions leading to poor pastures. He describes himself as an honest and hard-working man encouraging lenders to reduce interest rates.

loans.use: to buy veterinary drugs for his cows and herbicides for his crops

loans.name: Our Lady Parents School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Catherine. She is the Headteacher of Our Lady Parents School, a mixed school in the rural area of Luwero with 600 students.

Our Lady Parents School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistently clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced.

The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. Our Lady Parents School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Catherine ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Alvere

texts.en:
Alvere is 47 years old. She is married, with 3 children aged between 20 and 25 years; all of them are married.

She owns a shop and has been doing a business for the past 10 years.

With the loan requested, she would like to buy rice, beans, sugar and salt to sell.

The profits from the business will be used to make savings and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Salida

texts.en:
Salida is 35 years old woman, from Marneuli district. She lives with her pensioner mother and sister, who is temporarily unemployed. The family lives under poverty as having no source of income. 

Salida requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for her trading business startup but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because the creditors did not find the existing family income to be sufficient to approve the loan. 

Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program envisages provisions for business startups and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who, regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, do not have access to credit products. With the received credit, Salida will purchase stock of clothing and will start selling in her community. She will get private orders also and get her own customers. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly increase the family's living condition, as they will make a source of income and tackle with the financial difficulties. Salida awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase stock of clothing and to start a trading business

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is aged 54 years, has four children, all going to school and he is living in a rural setting. He deals in cattle keeping as well as cattle trading as a side business.  He works 7 days in a week and 12 hours per day and stated his business to earn living and get money to cater for his family members. 

He has requested for this loan to purchase more cows for fattening and later sell. He said that his clients are traders from his village and those from the nearby villages.
His hope for the future is to enlarge his cattle business and be the leading supplier of cows in his villages and the challenge he faces the most is too much drought which ends up leaving grass dry and limited water for his animals. This affects his output of course. 

But his plan is to acquire a loan to build a dam the next season, so he will be able to preserve the water for his animals. He describes himself as an honest and hardworking man who encourages lenders to continue supporting small entrepreneurs. He is grateful for the work done by Ugafode.

loans.use: To boost his cattle trade business

loans.name: Malahat

texts.en:
Malahat is 39 years old and married and has three children.  She is successful and very diligent woman and a farmer. She has started to work in her field 4 years ago . She wants to buy new fruit trees, to grow different fruits and then sell them in the market. She gives importance to human lives, that’s why she grows organic.  In addition in Azerbaijan, people prefer to buy fruits and vegetables from private gardens, because they are naturally raised and cheaper. 

Her biggest dream is to expand her land and to plant more seeds. But, for this, she has to have some funds. With this loan she will purchase more land and sow more seeds. We need Kiva lenders to support Malahat.

loans.use: to expand her land and to plant more organic trees and seeds

loans.name: Flor De Mayo Group

texts.en:
53 year old Manuela who, with 3 years of formal education, is the owner of a small production based business that produces aprons, huipiles and cortes (skirts that are traditionally worn by the Mayan women). Manuela is a member of the delightful trust bank “Flor de Mayo” or, May Flower, located in the quaint community of Cantel, Guatemala. “Flor de Mayo” comprises of 9 women yearning for a loan to help amplify their various small businesses which include: production and sale of textiles, sale of cold meats, and sale of school supplies. These women hope to improve their income to better help their families while playing a role in lifting their community form poverty.

Manuala is asking for a loan with the desire to buy typical fabrics and unique decorative items for her production of aprons and huipiles. With the added revenue form increased sales, Manuela will be able to support the payments of her household while simultaneously taking care of the needs of her 4 children. 

Aside from helping pave their way to a better life through micro loans, these women also have the opportunity to learn about topics specifically directed towards the woman which include: self-esteem, empowerment, rights of the woman, identity and gender, likewise topics of budgeting, business administration, and financial literacy. The mentioned topics are a part of Friendship Bridges Micro Credit Plus program, which reaches more than 22,000 women in both rural and urban areas of Guatemala.  Thank you Kiva for supporting the development of Guatemalan women!

loans.use: To buy typical fabrics and unique decorative items for her production of aprons

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tender corn for making "bollos".

loans.name: Ana Lucía

texts.en:
Ana, 59, is a mother of three who lives in Medellín. The most important thing in her life is her children, and she is always thinking of how she can give them the best in life. In 2006, thanks to a close friend who helped her at a difficult moment in her life, she saw an opportunity to support her children by opening a store where she sells clothes, fabrics and other products.

As a businesswoman Ana wants to see her business grow and realize an increase in her profits. She is applying for a 1,500,000 COP loan through Kiva's field partner Interactuar to stock up on clothes, fabrics, zippers, purses and other items.

This woman is not only a hero for what she does, but to her children who see her as the woman who has worked so hard for them. She wants see that they get good jobs and be successful. Help Ana give her children and herself a better life by giving her the opportunity to accomplish her dreams.

loans.use: to stock up on clothes, fabrics, zippers, purses and other items.

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
Ana, de 39 años de edad, está acompañada y es madre de 6 hijos.

Ana, es ama de casa, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y sus hijos están enfocados en sus estudios.

El crédito solicitado lo invertirán para comprar abono, insecticidas y pagar mano de obra. 

Sus planes a futuro son, darle la educación necesaria a sus hijos y crecerlos con valores y principios, también tienen como objetivo mejorar su vivienda para tener una calidad de vida muy favorable.
texts.en:
Ana is 39 years old. She is in a relationship and is the mother of 6 children. Ana is a housewife and her husband works in agriculture and her children are focused on their studies.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of manure, insecticide and pay for labor.

Her plans for the future are to provided the education necessary for her children and instill them with values and principals. She also has making improvements on her house as an objective in order to have a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy manure, insecticide and pay for labor.

loans.name: Nani

texts.en:
Nani is a 47-year-old widow woman from Tsalka district. She has two sons and two daughters and leads the family on her own. Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because she had to start working at a very young age, Nani was unable to study for a professional career.

Nani works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing potatoes, and breeds a cow, selling milk-products. She always has high quality products, which is sold to local retailers for a good price. Her daughters also generate some income from private working.

Nani decided to start a new type of business and sought credit among local financial institutions. The start-up program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 2,100 GEL for purchasing machinery and all needed tools to open a confectionery and bake various kinds of food products.
The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased regards Kiva Lenders. Nani will be very thankful for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase machinery and open a  confectionery

loans.name: Eneida Rosa

texts.en:
Eneida is a 46-years-old married woman who lives in Sincelejo with her husband  She started a new business just a month ago, a sshe raises cattle so she can help her husband with the expenses of the house because he doesn’t earn much and she wants to do something about that. 

She decided to support her husband thanking him for all the sacrifices that he has done for her. She didn’t have much to start her business but now he sees an opportunity to grow her business with the help of Corporación Interactuar, Kiva and some good people that are able to help her. She asked for a loan so she can buy a new sow. 

She thinks is a great opportunity to improve her sales and increase her profits, she also wants to get the conditions of her house better so she and her husband can live comfortably.   Help Eneida with a loan and she will be closer to accomplish her dreams.

loans.use: buy a new sow

loans.name: Chuimekena Group

texts.en:
“Chuimekena” is a trust bank that is located in a rural community of Totonicapan, some 202 kilometers from Guatemala City. “Chuimekena” consists of 7 women who are beginning their third loan cycle jointly with Friendship Bridge and Kiva who are supporting them in finding the development of the Guatemalan woman. 

The group is led by Ana, a very able 45 year old married mother of 3 girls, each of whom have graduated high school. Ana’s main source of income is derived from raising chickens, where she sells some in Totonicapan market and the rest from her home. With the new loan she is requesting, Ana plans to buy 150 new chickens, chicken feed, and dividers in order to separate the coups in sanitary conditions while allowing them to grow faster. 

Ana is very happy to be participating, along with her group, in the Microcredit Plus Program that is offered by Friendship Bridge. The microcredit plus program offers monthly non-formal education sessions which help guide the women to become more familiar with business administration, financial literacy, and woman’s rights. Thank you Kiva for being a part of this incredible development.

loans.use: 150 new chickens, chicken feed, and dividers in order to separate the coups in sanitary conditions

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima, 56 years old, is the mother of 6 children. In order to support her family, Fatima prepares Markouk, traditional Lebanese bread, and Mouneh, preserves.

As Fatima hopes to expand her work, she needs to develop her business by buying the Saj and other machines that she needs to produce traditional bread and food. In the long run, she also hopes to have her own market in which to sell her products. In order to do so, she needs a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua. Then she can expand her work and also add to it by starting a new business.

loans.use: to develop her business by buying a Saj and other machines that she needs to produce traditional bread and food.

loans.name: Marif

texts.en:
Marif is 51 years old, married, and from Imisli. He has four children. He earns money for his family by animal husbandry and selling their meat and wool at the local bazaar. He has been working in this field for 6 years and his monthly income is 900AZN.  Marif is not not happy because his earns not enough for his family. 

He have a serious problem - one of his children is sick. Marif’s child is suffering from lack of breathing. He needs loan to buy medicines. Kiva lenders may  show him some compassion.

loans.use: to buy medicines for his child

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián”, él socio continua trabajando como coordinador de entrega de combustible además crea programas informáticos, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a trabajar el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, a la vez el socio continua  con su negocio familiar que consiste en brindar servicio de internet, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de una maquina.
 El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a member of the Communal Bank “Patrón de San Sebastián”. He continues to work as a fuel delivery coordinator, but he also writes computer programs. Ricardo has been at his job for a long time and he is also doing well in his business thanks to the effort he puts forth each day. At the same time, he continues to run the family business of providing Internet services. By working in this manner, he is able to help his family get ahead.

Ricardo is requesting a loan so that he can maintain one of his machines. He is grateful for the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of one of his machines.

loans.name: Yasmin Del Carmen

texts.es: Yasmin de 31 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 6 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, Yasmin está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para damas, caballerosy niños, para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejore ingresos y darle a su hija una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Yasmin is 31 and a single mother. She lives in a house she owns with her daughter. She has worked selling clothes for the last six years, her business is located at her residence. She has many established customers due to the quality of the clothes and good prices.  Yasmin is requesting a loan to buy women, men and children's clothing for sale.  With the loan, she will be able to continue with her sales and have more income and give her daughter a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy women, men and children's clothing for sale.

loans.name: Twuzuzanye Sub Group

texts.en:
Alice is a group leader; aged 31 years. She is married with 3 children aged between 7 and 11 years. The group is called TWUZUZANYE means “WORK TOGETHE” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. 

She owns a bar and has been running the business for 7 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beer for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more beer for sale.

loans.name: Luzdina

texts.es:
Luzdina tiene 27 años de edad, separada, vive con su hijo en una zona rural del distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Luzdina se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 8 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Luzdina espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luzdina is 27, she is separated and lives with her son in a rural area of the Pucara district. It is located in the province of Jaen, Cajamarca in the North mountain range of Peru.  The inhabitants of this district are mainly dedicated to agriculture, livestock farming and commerce.

Luzdina works in agriculture, specifically coffee plantation. She has 8 years of experience in the business and very good personal and professional references.  The loan will be used to buy fertilizers to properly maintain her coffee plantation and to hire and pay for laborers during harvest season.  This way Luzdina hopes to offer better quality coffee to her customers and have a positive impact in her income, her quality of life and her family’s.

loans.use: o buy fertilizers to properly maintain her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Ever Jose

texts.en:
Ever is a 45 years old, father of 4 children, with whom he lives in the municipality of Sahagun, in the Atlantic Colombian coast, place that was beaten by the war years ago and now is recovering from that. This gentle father works really hard to make his family progress and live a good life, that´s why he started his business and now he’s a farmer; he grows different kind of products.   

He learned all what he knows thanks to his father that taught him everything that he needed to know, thanks to that he could start his business in a really difficult moment when he lack of job. Now he wants to expand his farm, for that he asked for a loan to stock up and buy some seeds, poisons and other stuff that he needs to do his job. 

He lives for seeing his family being happy, that´s why he´s such a hard worker, so he can give to his children the education they deserved, so his job as a father will be as good as his job as a farmer, and it’s certainly is. You can help Ever to success in both jobs by loaning and giving him the opportunity to improve every day.

loans.use: to stock up and buy some seeds, poisons and other stuff

loans.name: Yuris Patricia

texts.en:
Yuris is 31 years old and is a married woman and a mother too, she has two children, a beautiful daughter who is just 3 and a son who is 9 years old. She has a business since 2013 that she started, thanks to her love of farm work. Right now she raises cattle and wants to grow her business. 

She works really hard to see her business grow; she is aware of the big competition that exists in los Palmitos, municipality where she lives, that’s why she asked for a loan so she can buy two more sows, so she can raise them and increase her profits and sales. 

For Yuris, her family is the most important thing in her life, that´s why she knows how much she has to work to give them a good quality of life and the education is a big part of that, something that she dreams, giving that to her children will make her feel realized as a mother and see her children success a happy one. Help Yuris accomplish her dreams with a loan.

loans.use: buy two more sows

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz is from Imishli. He is 24 years old and at this young age is very energetic and passionate.
He is single and is living with his family. Currently he is working at the petrol station and is very good and sociable person concerning treating the customer. Aziz is the only one working in the family and taking care of the needs in the family, which consists of very old mother and father. 

Currently Aziz is very ill. He is has problems in his liver. Doctors have suggested a treatment and the medicines. He needs loan to buy drugs and to get treated. For this he needs Kiva lenders’ support.

loans.use: to buy drugs and to get treated

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is glad that she availed and is faithfully repaying her loan of 25000 PHP which she used to purchase items and products needed in her business. Her friendly personality helped her direct selling products. Although there are times that it's hard to collect receivables, she maintains her positive attitude that God will see her through.

Jocelyn trusts that she can apply for a 30000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed for her business. She needs to fill her customers' advance orders promptly now that it is school time. She praises God for your good heart in financing her livelihood.

Jocelyn dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her child will get a college education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for clothing, footwear, and skin and beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 34-year-old married woman who started selling cosmetics almost two years ago to help her husband cover their needs and expenses. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady, who is succeeding in gaining her own customers. She has a good reputation among her customers.

Fatima is working hard and trying desperately to develop her business and improve her family's living conditions. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of cosmetics to satisfy her customers' needs, as she wants to buy necessary home appliances for her house. 

Fatima hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of cosmetics and to buy home appliances for her house.

loans.name: Josefa Antonia

texts.en:
Josefa is 55 years old mother of 3 children, whom she loves very much and they are the reason why she still wakes up every morning and works really hard. She lives in the municipality of Sahagun in the Colombian Atlantic coast, where she owns a raising chickens business, which gives her the support she needs to supply her family.

She comes from a strong mother that taught her how to work hard for her family and be confident as a woman, that´s why nothing stops her in her way to be successful and support her family. She is lacking of money right now to stock up that´s why she’s asking for a loan so she can buy more chickens and food to feed them. She expects that this loan will allow her to increase her sales and that way improve her profits.

She wishes with repair her house that isn’t in its best condition right now, and she considers that important to make her family feel comfortable and protected. This strong woman needs a little help and you can give it to her through a loan, do it now and help a woman that deserves the best in life.

loans.use: buy more chickens and food to feed them

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 37 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more household goods to sell.

Annie has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more household goods to sell

loans.name: Remberto Enrique

texts.en:
Remberto is a 38 years old man, father of 6 children, something he dreamed since he was really young, to have a big family so he could be a great father and support them. It hasn’t been easy for him, but he has worked really hard to give to all of them what they need so they have a good quality of life. Remberto owns a farm where he raises chickens, and with that business he supports his family.

One day a friend decided to help him because Remberto didn’t have a job, so he not only taught him everything, but help him start, even so he lack of money to make his business grow, that´s the reason why he decided to asked for a loan, so he can buy more chickens and food to stock up. He wants to see his business remain running well.

Remberto has a big responsibility with his big family, and he’s aware that he has to make a lot of sacrifices for them, but he does it with love and commitment, dreaming with paying all of them the best education so they can be professionals one day. You can help this devoted father to accomplish his dreams through a loan that will get him closer to do it.

loans.use: buy more chickens and food to stock up

loans.name: Faber Luis

texts.en:
Faber is 31 years old and lives in Valdivia, municipality located in the north of Antioquia; there he lives with his three amazing sons, who are 6, 5 and 2 years old, and are the motor of Faber´s life. This responsible and committed man worked for around 10 hours a day, 7 days of the week in his motorcycle, where he gives service of transportation to people.

In Colombia this kind of business are really popular in the municipalities, and is called motorcycle-taxi, and it’s a motorcycle with a little space behind where people can transport around three people. Faber doesn’t have this yet, he only has a simple motorcycle that only let him transport one person, so with the goal to increase his profits, he´s asking for a loan so he can buy a motorcycle-taxi, with which he can improve his business.

He wants to see his business last in time, and to improve the conditions of his house so his boys can grow up in a good home where they are protected. Faber needs a little help, and you can be the person who gives it to him, loan now and change this family life.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle-taxi

loans.name: Rafiq

texts.en:
Rafiq is 29 years old and married. Rafiq's family consists of 2 children and his wife. He is a farmer and Rafiq has started his work about 4 years ago. He has gained a lot of experience, but currently he is not happy about the situation of his farm.  Due to water shortage he cannot earn enough income. He needs money to buy a water tank and improve his business. He loves his family and knows that with a growing and expanded business he can also improve his family's life condition. 

Therefore, he applied for a 1,200 AZN loan. He will use this money to buy more fertilizers and garden tools.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and garden tools.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Helen has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Helen would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
A hardworking entrepreneur with three children, Lilia sells charcoal in the Philippines. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures including food vending.

Lilia has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal for her business. She dreams that one day she will be able to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal for her business

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Editha has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Editha would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bamboo weaving business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional bamboo to weave for her bamboo weaving business.

Emily has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional bamboo to weave

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 59 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell kitchenware business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of kitchenware to sell.

Gladys has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future Gladys would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of kitchenware to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from rice retailing. Grace is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc. for her food vending business.

Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Yonaida

texts.en:
Yonaida is 46 years old and has two children who live with her in Medellín. For more than twenty years she has sold fruits and vegetables. Her time in the business has made her an expert in this job, and so she knows how to buy and sell only the best produce. Even though there is a lot of competition in the city, customers prefer buying from her for this reason.

Yonaida keeps her store full of a wide variety of produce. Her strategy is that her numerous offerings will attract many customers, but doing so can be expensive. So she is applying for a 3,000,000 COP loan through Kiva's field partner Interactuar to buy more fruits and vegetables and so keep ahead of customer demand.

Yonaida’s house is not in the best condition, and she dreams of improving it. She´s also committed to seeing her business improve every day. Help Yonaida through this loan to keep moving toward accomplishing her goals.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables and so keep ahead of customer demand.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 40 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living from raising pigs in the Philippines. Lorena is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lorena has been raising pigs for 17 years now. She earns additional income from farming rice.

Lorena is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Lovella

texts.en:
Ma. Lovella, a 39-year-old married woman with two children, works very hard to provide for her family. For eight years she has been running a general store in the Philippines.

Ma. Lovella has requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, bread, etc. In the future she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, bread, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in her beauty salon business and buy new merchandise

loans.name: Hidayet

texts.en:
Hidayat is 55 years old, married with three children and he is from Imishli. He is a farmer and his wife is a nurse. 

Hidayat grows and sells fruits (apples, oranges, pears, lemons, bananas, etc.) and vegetables (greens, potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, onions and so on) at the local bazaar. His monthly income is 870AZN. Azeri people like eating delicious and fresh vegetables. Besides that, vegetables are used in preparing different soups (tomato soup, lentil soup), salads, national dishes such as roasted eggplant, etc. 

Demand for fruit is also high. People use fruits to make fresh juice, fruit pies, and different sorts of jam. He needs an irrigation system for watering his plants. Hidayat will use this money to buy new watering equipment, also requires Kiva lenders support.

loans.use: to buy new watering equipment for his trees and vegetables

loans.name: 7 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
El comité “7 de agosto” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de una comunidad humilde de la ciudad de Santaní, son luchadoras y sostienen a sus familias con mucho sacrificio.
Una de las integrantes que se caracteriza por ser  muy emprendedora es la Sra. Sinecia quien se dedica a la cría de animales y la vez vende huevo, queso y otros productos derivados de origen animal. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que lucha por poder salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar balanceados para sus animales, y de esa forma poder seguir con su sacrificado trabajo para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The "7 de agosto" committee formed with the union of several neighbors from a humble community in the city of Santaní. They are fighters and support their families with great sacrifice. 

One of the members, known for being very determined, is Señora Sinecia, who raises animals and also sells eggs, cheese and other animal products. She is a very hardworking woman who fights to keep on going and help her family. 

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy animal feed for her animals so that she can continue with her demanding job and help her family.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Be Happy With Loans - N2T1Thvận Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chương is 53 years old and married with one child.
 
She has worked in agriculture raising pigs for five years.

Chương lives in a rural town in the Thanh Hoa province.

She comes from a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region. She has no collateral so she can't get a loan from traditional banks or credit institutions.

The main hardship that Chương faces is a lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase pigs to raise and sell.

This is Chương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

She is the group leader of the "Be happy with loans - N2T1ThVận", which consists of three members.

Chương hopes to maintain a successful business and that her family will be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 61 years old and has four children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Helen has been pig fattening for 37 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Catherine has been in this business for 22 years. She earns more income from pig fattening. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 43 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, etc.

Cecilia has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice grains.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Cecilia aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 44 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Jane is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

Jane has been pig fattening for four years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El  Sr. Pedro es de la ciudad de Santaní tiene 45 años, está casado con la Sra. Claudina, con quien tiene dos hijos, quienes ya son mayores e independiente, que criaron con mucho sacrificio.
El  Sr. Pedro ttiene una Tornería en su casa,  con clientela formada, es un señor muy trabajador, excelente persona que es conocido en su barrio por el buen trabajo que hace.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de chapas que usa en su negocio, y de esa forma poder seguir ganándose la vida de una manera digna y honesta.
texts.en:
Mr. Pedro is from the city of Santani. He is 45 years old and married to Claudina. They have two grown children whom they raised with much sacrifice but who are now on their own. 

Mr. Pedro has a machine shop in his house. He has an established clientele, is very hard-working, and an excellent person who is known in his neighborhood for the good work he does. He is requesting this loan to purchase metal sheets that he will use in his business. In this way, he will be able to continue earning his living in a dignified and honest manner.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheets to use in his machine shop

loans.name: Mario Edgardo

texts.es: Mario de 29 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que habita en vivienda propia junto a su hija de 5 años y se ha esmerado por salir adelante con su pequeña como papa soltero. Mario es un hombre emprendedor que para salir adelante se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas como mora, rábano, cilantro y ejote desde hace once años, por lo que se siente feliz de contar con esa fuente de ingresos. Mario desea incrementar sus ingresos por lo que ha decido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: compra de semillas de cilantro y rábano así como abono y veneno para plagas, para poder aumentar su producción, obtener mejores ingresos y poder  darle así una mejor calidad de vida a su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Mario is a hardworking man who is 29 years old and resides in his own home along with his five-year-old daughter. He has worked to get ahead since he is a single father with a young child. Mario is an enterprising man who has been able to move forward by growing crops such as blackberries, radishes, cilantro, and green beans. He has been doing this for 11 years and is pleased to have this be his source of income.

Mario wants to increase his earnings, so he has decided to request a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in the purchase of cilantro and radish seeds. He will also buy compost and pest controls, which will help to increase his production. As a result, Mario will be able to generate more income and provide a better quality of life for his young daughter.

loans.use: to buy cilantro and radish seeds, compost, and pest controls.

loans.name: Lenisa

texts.en:
Lenisa is 32 years old and married. With three children who are in school, Lenisa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, coffee, etc.

Lenisa has been in this business for five years.

In the future Lenisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Levy

texts.en:
Levy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Levy has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Levy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines.

Delia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall. She has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Delia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Cristian

texts.en:
Cristian is twenty years old and lives in Sahagun on Colombia’s Caribbean coastline. At his young age he has his own operation raising cattle, which he started thanks to a friend who helped him. He established this venture to help his family get by, and he knew he had the energy and ability to do so.

At this time the resources he needs to manage his business are very hard on his budget, so he is applying for a 700,000 COP loan so he can buy fodder for his animals plus a breeding sow. He feels these moves will enable him to raise his output and his profits as well.

As a young man Cristian dreams really big. He wants to work hard to give his family a better life so as to thank them for all the sacrifices they have made for him. The family home is not in the best condition, so he wants to repair it so his family can feel comfortable and protected. Through this loan you can help Cristian realize his dreams.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his cattle plus a breeding sow.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
La socia Pamela pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. 
La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de alquilar carros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar llantas entre otros.
texts.en:
Pamela is a member of the Communal Bank “Patrón de San Sebastián”, which is in the city of Cusco. She continues to manage a car rental business. Pamela has been this business for quite some time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work. She is a responsible person who works in this manner so that her family can get ahead.

Pamela is requesting a loan in order to buy tires and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy tires and other supplies.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria is 65 years old, married, and has nine children.  

She is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. Demetria requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries for farm preparation.

Demetria has been farming rice for 40 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Demetria would like to save enough to buy more farmlands.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries for farm preparation

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a sack of cassava flour and a sack of beans

loans.name: Kalipa

texts.ru: Калипа, 54 года, замужем, есть 2 детей. У нее высшее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, вместе с супругом занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2011 году с суммы 20,000 сом (KGS). Также шьет на заказ национальные изделия. Благодаря упорному труду, Калипа на сегодняшний день имеет 2 коровы и 10 овец. На участке мерою 1,80 Га собственной земли она выращивает фасоль для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Калипа обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, лекарств для сада и обработку и прополку почвы для выращивания экологически чистой продукции. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Kalipa is 54 years old, married, and has 2 children. She has a post-secondary education, and she and her husband raise animals and crops as the primary source of income for their family. They began doing this in 2011, with 20,000 som (KGS). Kalipa also sews traditional items. Thanks to Kalipa's very hard work, she now has 2 cows and 10 sheep. She grows beans for resale on a 1.80 hectare plot of her own land.

In order to further develop her business, Kalipa has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy fertilizer, medicines for her garden, and to cultivate and weed the soil to grow organic products. She plans to use the proceeds from her loan to continue developing her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, medicines for her garden, and to cultivate her land to grow organic beans.

loans.name: Sugey Del Carmen

texts.en:
Sugey is 32 years old and lives in Sahagun, on the Colombian Atlantic coast. She has two little girls, one who is six and the other who is just two years old. She started her own business, thanks to her mother-in-law who taught her everything that she needed to know about raising chickens, which is what she does right now. 

This strong and confident woman wants to see her business grow, so her family can benefit from it. That’s why she asked for a loan, so she can buy more chickens and food to improve her inputs. She wants her job to last.

She dreams of giving her daughters an excellent education, so they can do better in the future, that they will be good people and give the best to their own families. Help Sugey accomplish her dreams with just a loan, which will get her closer to achieving them.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and food to improve her inputs.

loans.name: San Valentin Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Valentin  está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, todas se pusieron como meta poder crecer en sus emprendimientos, todas a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo van mejorando cada día.
Deisy es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a ser manicurista, es muy buena en lo que hace, es por ello que tiene ya muy buena clientela que siempre le hace muchos pedidos. Deisy está poniendo todo lo mejor de sí para poder capacitarse y mejorar sus condicione de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder seguir con su buen servicio a sus clientes, quiere comprar esmaltes, acetonas, alicates y otros. Agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de poder mejorar.
texts.en:
The San Valentin group is in its second cycle of the program of the women's committee. All of them set as a goal to grow in their undertakings; through effort and continuous work, they are all improving every day. 

Deisy is part of this group. She is a manicurist and is very good at what she does. She already has a good clientele always requesting her. Deisy is putting forth her best to be able to improve and improve her living conditions. 

She is requesting a loan to be able to continue providing good service to her clients. She wants to buy nail polish, nail polish remover, clippers and other things. 

They are grateful for the opportunity they are receiving to be able to improve.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, nail polish remover, clippers and other things.

loans.name: Upendo Oysterbay Group

texts.en:
Edna, who is in her early 30s, is single with two children who are still in school. She has been selling clothes and making and selling bedsheets door to door for five years now. She works from 9am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Edna's 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on her rejects and has successfully paid back all of her loans. She is doing fine and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy clothes and materials for making bedsheets to sell up-country. She dreams of growing her business and selling to other countries.

Edna will share this loan with her loan group Upendo Oysterbay which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes and materials for making bedsheets to sell up-country.

loans.name: Loans Change My Life - 04Đa Phạnhlộc Group

texts.en:
Nguyệt is 31 years old and married with three children. She has had a retail business selling medication for more than 10 years. 

Nguyệt lives in Hau Loc district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, the market need is low in this region. 

The main hardship that Nguyệt faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase medicine to resell. In 2012, Nguyệt joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Nguyệt has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of "Loans Change My Life - 04Đa PhạnHLộc," which consists of six members.

With her business profit, Nguyệt hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase medicine to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase 160 litres of petrol

loans.name: Raelyn

texts.en:
Raelyn is a new mother looking for a way to bring in additional income for her young family. A fan of the products, Raelyn decided to become an independent beauty consultant with Mary Kay. She felt she would be a good fit for the role because of her previous experience in the beauty industry selling wraps and skin-tightening products.

Through her business, Raelyn will provide personalized skin care for all skin types, as well as fragrances. With the help of Kiva supporters, she will use her loan to purchase her first cosmetic and skin care inventory with Mary Kay. She will also be purchasing sample products to display at parties to promote her new business.

Raelyn travels often and will be able to capitalize on this being a mobile business by carrying her product with her at all times. She also plans on marketing her products on Facebook and Instagram, and will take advantage of her extensive network of family and friends to receive word-of-mouth referrals.

loans.use: to purchase her first cosmetic and skin care inventory.

loans.name: Margelina

texts.en:
Margelina is 53 years old and married with nine children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market.

Margelina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Mujeres Maravilla Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Mujeres Maravilla, ellas son de la ciudad de Caaguazú, se unieron para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en equipo, y además se encuentran dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una persona que se destaca por su buena predisposición siempre, y por participar de manera activa, es la Sra. Miguelina, quien se dedica a las costuras, comenta que hace todo tipo de confecciones para poder ganarse la vida de una manera digna y sin privaciones para sus seres queridos.
Miguelina comenta que es conocida en el barrio  por hacer buenas confecciones y atender muy bien a sus clientes, pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas e hilos, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group is called Marvelous Women, they are from the city of Caaguazú.  They united to be able to help their families by working as a team.  Furthermore they find an end to poverty through participation in the program.  

One person who stands out for her good disposition and for her active participation is the Senora Miguelina, who works as a seamstress.  She says that she does all types of tailoring to earn a living in a dignified way so that her family isn't lacking for anything.  

Miguelina says that she is known in the neighborhood for her quality dressmaking and for taking good care of her customers.  She is asking for this loan to be able to purchase fabric and thread.  This way she can continue with her work without interruption.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread for dressmaking.

loans.name: Marialy

texts.en:
Marialy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a blacksmith business in the Philippines.

She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wood, iron, charcoal, etc.

Marialy has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wood, iron, charcoal, etc.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann works hard to support her family. Mary Ann is married and has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes hoy tiene 29 años, continua trabajando en su despensa, la cual es la fuente de ingresos para su familia, ya que por medio de ello puede darles una mejor calidad de vida. Comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior pudo surtir su despensa, lo que le fue de mucha ayuda.
Lourdes para poder seguir con su trabajo necesita de este préstamo, ya que quiere comprar carne, bebidas, frutas, verduras y otros productos de primera necesidad para seguir cumpliendo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 29 years old.  She works at her grocery shop, which is a source of income for her family.  With her earnings she is able to give her family a better quality of life.  

She mentioned that through her previous loan she was able to supply her shop, which was very helpful.  

Lourdes needs this loan to be able to continue with her work.  She would like to purchase meat, drinks, fruits, vegetable and other basic products to continue filling her clients' orders.

loans.use: to purchase meat, drinks, fruits, vegetables and other products.

loans.name: Km 9 Monday Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Km 9 Monday ” es un grupo nuevo que se unió para poder dar lo mejor de sí y poder ayudar a sus familias. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza para poder ir mejorando cada día.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Cirila, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir está en una pobreza extrema. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, que lo hace de manera ambulante, y con su trabajo da a su familia lo que necesitan.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtirse con más tipo de prendas de invierno, ya que se acerca el frio y quiere poder dar a sus clientes lo que necesitan. Agradece por la oportunidad de crecer que está recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group "Kilometer 9 Monday" is a new group which got together to be able to give their all and to help their families.  They are in the program to eliminate poverty to be able to improve every day.  

One of the members is Senora Cirila, who, in her survey, noted a poverty level of Level 1, in other words, extreme poverty.  She sells various clothing items door to door.  With her work, she gives her family what they need.  

She is asking for this loan to be able to supply herself with more types of winter clothing, as the cold weather is coming and she wants to be able to sell her customers what they need.  She is thankful for the opportunity to grow that she is receiving, as the loan will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothing for resale.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita works hard to support her family. Rita is a widow and has a buy-and-sell fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

Rita has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bamboo weaving business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo to weave.

Vicenta has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo to weave

loans.name: Jhoena

texts.en:
A 48-year-old married mother of four, Jhoena works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Jhoena, who has borrowed and repaid 14 previous loans from NWTF, has requested a new one for PHP 10000 to purchase additional items to sell such as spices, soap, milk, canned goods, etc. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as spices, soap, milk, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Banco Mujer Sembrando Esperanza Group

texts.es: Marilyn es una mujer con 28 años de edad, casada y madre de tres hijos, todos menores de edad y dos de ellos cursan la primaria. Es esforzada y trabajadora, siempre busca el bien para ella y su familia. Vive en una comunidad rural Semillero. Inició su actividad hace dos años, debido a que tiene la necesidad de ayudar en su hogar, porque su esposo trabaja en una finca bananera y lo que percibe de salario es poco para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Éste es uno de los motivos por el cual ella decide iniciar su negocio de confección de ropa interior, pijamas y también cose a la medida. Emprende su actividad en la misma casa, para poder de igual manera cuidar a sus hijos. Sale a vender su mercadería cuando sus dos hijos se van a la escuela por las tardes, y el otro hijo se lo cuida su madre. Siempre ha querido tener independencia económica y siente que ésta es una oportunidad para lograrlo en el futuro. Solicita éste préstamo para la compra de una máquina de cosere insumos como telas, hilos, encajes, elásticos y más. Ella es una socia del Banco Mujer Sembrando Esperanza, que se formó hace aproximadamente 9 meses en la comunidad de Semillero. Lo conforman junto con ella seis socias más, que buscan los mismos objetivos crecer en sus diferenctes actividades económicas para mejorar la calidad de vida de ellas y sus familias. Van invertir sus préstamos en las actividades de comercio, manualidades y confección.
texts.en:
Marilyn is a 28 year-old married woman and mother of three young children, two of whom are in primary school. She is enthusiastic and hardworking, always seeking the best for herself and her family. She lives in the rural community of Semillero.

She began her work two years ago due to the need to help out in her household. Her spouse works on banana farm and what he receives as a salary is little to meet the basic needs of the household. This is one of the reasons for deciding to start her business making undergarments, pijamas and tailoring. She works from home so she can also care for her children. She sells her merchandise when her two children go to school in the afternoon and cares for her other son herself. 

She has always wanted to have economic independence and feels that this is an opportunity to achieve it in the future. She is requesting this loan to buy a sewing machine and supplies like fabric, thread, lace, elastic and more. 

She is a member of Banco Mujer Sembrando Esperanza which was formed approximately 9 months ago in the Semillero community. It is composed of six other members with the same objectives: to grow in their different economic activities in order to improve the quality of life for themselves and their families. They are going to invest their loans in trade, handicrafts and dressmaking.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and supplies.

loans.name: Regen

texts.en:
Regen is 33 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. Regen works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc .

Regen has been in this business for six years.

In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Elida De Lourdes

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Elida, quien con su credikiva pudo surtir sus negocios con nuevos sabores de Helados y materias primas necesarias para la confección, permitiéndole incrementar sus ventas, cumplir con sus compromisos y obtener un mayor margen de ganancia; por eso ella dice a los financiadores de Kiva “Gracias por apoyar los sueños de los pequeños microempresarios”. En la actualidad está aplicando su segundo credikiva, con el cual surtirá con helados de distintos sabores y comprará telas. Su credikiva nuevamente será todo un éxito gracias a su compromiso y dedicación.
texts.en:
Thanks for supporting Elida who, with her Kiva loan, was able to stock up her business with new ice cream flavors and raw materials necessary for her sewing.  This allowed her to increase her sales, complete her commitments, and get a larger margin of profit.  For this she says to the Kiva lenders, "Thanks for supporting the dreams of small business owners."

At the moment, she is applying for her second Kiva loan, with which she will stock up with different flavors of ice cream and buy fabric.  Her Kiva loan will again be a success thanks to her commitment and dedication.

loans.use: To stock up with ice creams of different flavors and buy fabric

loans.name: Olga Nelly

texts.es:
Olga es una mujer emprendedora y aplicado, desde hace 3 años comenzó con una legumbreria que hasta ahora le ha dado muy buenos resultados. 

Ella vive en el municipio de Medellín con su madre a la cual manifiesta que tiene mucho que agradecerle en la vida.

Ella trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8:00 Am hasta las 5:00 Pm atendiendo un número de cliente medianamente alto.

Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar productos a como plátanos, aguacates, tomates, entre otros y de éste modo satisfacer los deseos de los clientes que le piden estos productos.

Esta ayuda le permitirá inyectar variedad a su negocio y le brindara la jugosa oportunidad de mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Olga is an enterprising and hard-working woman. Three years ago, she started a fruit and vegetable store that has so far had very good results.

She lives in the town of Medellín with her mother and she says she has a lot in her life to thank her mother for.

She works from Monday to Saturday, from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm, serving a moderately high number of clients.

She is asking for a loan to buy products such as bananas, avocados, tomatoes and other items so that she can meet the needs of her clients when they ask for these products.

This help will allow her to inject some variety into her business and it will afford her the juicy opportunity to improve her sales and family income.

loans.use: to buy products such as bananas, avocados, tomatoes and other items to meet the needs of her clients.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo denominado Mujeres Unidas inicia el programa de comité de mujeres, donde desarrollaran trabajos en equipo y la ayuda solidaria. 
La Sra. Mirtha, es una  de las integrantes quien se dedica a la peluquería, se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, y con sacrificio ha ido creciendo y mejorando. Ella se unió al grupo para poder ir mejorando poco a poco y con ello ayudar a su familia y sus demás seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, cremas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su buen servicio a sus clientes como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The group named “Mujeres Unidas” is starting the Women’s Communal Bank Program, in which they are working as a team and helping each other in solidarity. 

Señora Mirtha, one of the members, is a hair-stylist. She has developed a good clientele, and by making sacrifices, she has been growing and improving. She joined the group in order to be able to gradually continue improving, and thus help her family and the rest of her loved ones.

She is requesting this loan so that she can purchase hair-color, shampoo, rinses, creams, and other items. In this way, she can continue providing good service to her clients as she has been doing.  She appreciates the opportunity to grow and get ahead that she is receiving.

loans.use: to purchase hair-color, shampoo, rinses, creams, and other items.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
La Sra. Amalia es de la ciudad de Concepción, comenta que  su actividad principal es la   despensa y también la venta de comidas y minutas, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que se esfuerza por poder crecer y mejorar cada día.
Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada y luchadora que quiere seguir creciendo, es por eso que pide este préstamo, para poder surtir su despensa con productos, como ser: bebidas, panificados, lácteos, carne y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
Sra. Amalia is from the city of Concepción. She says that her main business activity is managing her store, but she also sells snacks and meals-to-go. Amada is a hardworking and determined woman who strives to grow and improve each day.

She is also a self-sacrificing and strong individual who desires to keep developing. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can restock her store with products such as beverages, baked goods, dairy items, meat, and other things. She appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can grow and improve each day.

loans.use: to buy beverages, baked goods, dairy items, meat, and other products.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “San Roque ” se formó en ciudad del este, son mujeres muy luchadoras que están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando cada una por poder superarse.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Norma, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir, está en un nivel de pobreza extrema. Norma vende ropas de todo tipo y comenta que aunque la vida sea difícil, ella pone todo de sí para poder mejorar en su negocio, ya que a través de el puede dar a su familia lo que necesitan para una vida digna.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar, jeans, remeras, camisas, pantalones y otros, y de esa manera poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, y agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer.
texts.en:
The “San Roque” was formed in the Ciudad del Este. These women are fighters who are in the poverty elimination program, fighting to be able to get ahead.   One of the members is Norma, who in her survey showed a poverty level at level one. That is, she is in extreme poverty. Norma sells all types of clothing and remarks that even if life is difficult, she puts all of herself into improving the business, since through it she can give her family what they need to have a dignified life. 

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy jeans, t-shirts, shirts, pants and more. This way, she can continue with her sales as she has been doing, and she is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to grow.

loans.use: to buy jeans, t-shirts, shirts, pants, and other items of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Melvy

texts.es:
Melvy es una mujer de 31 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 2 años, y estudia la carrera de gastronomía. 
Ella es inteligente, comprometida, constante, dulce, cariñosa, sensible, responsable y muy trabajadora. Sus estudios lo realiza en un instituto técnico de excelencia en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’, ubicado a 25 kilómetros al sur este de la ciudad donde los pobladores se dedican mayormente a actividades agropecuarias, los jóvenes y niños adoptan rápidamente un trabajo para apoyar a sus familias, dejando de lado los estudios. Los trabajos normalmente están relacionados a cuidado de ganado y niñeras o ayudante de albañiles en la ciudad. Dichas actividades son riesgosas y llevan a los niños, niñas y adolescentes a posibles situaciones de explotación laboral.
Melvy es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo amarrado por detrás de la nuca, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza junto a sus padres que trabajan administrando una pensión y con su hijo que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica, utilizan agua de pozo extraída mediante una bomba. Ella cursa la carrera de gastronomía y se encuentra en 1 año de 3 años que dura la carrera; disfruta ayudando a las personas, le gusta hacer degustar los sabores y esencias naturales de su cocina, su carácter es de servicio, “estudio gastronomía y trabajo en la pensión de mis padres, en poco tiempo el negocio familiar esta mejorando…” comenta. para lelamente a sus estudios ella trabaja como cocinera en la pensión familiar propiedad de sus padres. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es que le deja tiempo para estudiar gastronomía. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante grande, ella desea realizar la compra de una computadora portátil para continuar estudiando para que su negocio continúe mejorando. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Melvy solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora portátil para continuar estudiando gastronomía.
texts.en:
Melvy is a 31 year old woman. She is single with a 2 year old son and majors in gastronomy. She is intelligent, committed, tenacious, sweet, caring, sensitive, responsible and hard working. She carries out her studies at a technical institute of excellence in the town of Sacaba which is located 25 kilometers to the south of the city where the residents make a living mainly in agriculture. The adolescents and the children quickly take on a job to support their families and put their studies aside. The jobs are normally related to the care of livestock, nannies, or construction worker helpers in the city. These jobs are risky and bring the boys, girls, and adolescents possible labor exploitation situations.

Melvy has tan skin, brown eyes, long black hair that she ties behind her neck, and a thin physical build. Her native language is Quechua which is spoken there and she also speaks Spanish for the general culture and for business. She carries out her life alongside her parents who manage a guesthouse and with her son who is still not school-age. They live in their own home which is made of adobe with a roof made of corrugated iron and a cement floor. They count on the electrical energy service and use water from a well that is extracted from a pump. 

She is studying gastronomy and she is currently in her first of the three years of the career. She enjoys helping people and she likes to have them savor the flavors and natural essences of her kitchen. Service is in her nature. She comments, "I study gastronomy and work in my parents' hostel. In a short time, my family's business is improving..." Parallel to her studies, she also works as a cook in her family's guesthouse on her parents' property. The benefit of her business is that she can count on daily sales, but the disadvantage is that it doesn't leave her time to study gastronomy. Her dream is to open a big restaurant. She wishes to achieve the purchase of a lap top in order to continue studying so that her business can continue improving. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in one year of developing this career. It is for these reasons that Melvy is requesting a loan to purchase a lap top to continue studying gastronomy.

loans.use: to buy a laptop in order to continue studying gastronomy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drawers, nail clippers, skin creams, padlocks, thermoses, etc.

loans.name: Dúo Bienaventurados Group

texts.es:
Dúo Bienaventurados
Este dúo está conformado por Erika es originarias de Sumpango, Sac ella es casada y madre de familia, el negocio que tiene es la venta de refacciones así como también la venta de comida, erika tiene un puesto a un costado del parque de Sumpango en donde vende diferentes tipos de refacciones  desde golosinas hasta licuados de frutas,  y cuenta que gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien, pero últimamente no ha podido surtir su negocio por lo que  solicita un crédito  a kiva para comprar productos comestibles para la elaboración de refacciones para la venta y así poder incrementar sus ventas y seguir ayudando a sus hijos que ya están estudiando.
texts.en:
Erika is a member of Dúo Bienaventurados. She is originally from Sumpango, Sacatepequez. She is married and has children.

Her business is in the sale of refreshments as well as the sale of food. Erika has a stand on the side of a park in Sumpango where she sells different kinds of refreshments and snacks, from candy to fruit licuados (a drink made from fruit, similar to a smoothie). 

She tells us that the grace of God has guided her well, but recently she has been unable to get supplies for her business, which is why she is requesting a loan from Kiva. She needs the loan to be able to buy ingredients for her refreshments so that she can increase sales and continue supporting her children as they attend school.

loans.use: to buy supplies so she can make refreshments

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elsa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Elsa is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of firewood to sell for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elsa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of firewood to sell

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Mark Adrian is 16 years old and first of the three children in the family. Crisanta is his mother, who has been the member of NWTF-Project Dungganon for many years. She helps her husband with a food vending business.

Crisanta is taking a loan to pay for the tuition fee of her son, Mark Adrian, worth Php 8,309 for his first semester of a four-year course.

Mark Adrian is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Hotel Management and he plans to help his parents and his brother and sister with college when he graduates.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Maria Chona

texts.en:
