Because of his kindness, good prices, and the quality of his products, he has managed to attract a good number of customers, who demand new and varied products each day. For this reason and with a view to increase his inventory, José decided to ask for a loan from FUSAI to purchase more merchandise. In this way, he will be able to satisfy his customers' needs.

With the loan, he plans to buy sodas, basic grains, bread, vegetables, dairy products, snacks, and the like as well as a shelf to display his products.

loans.use: to buy sodas, basic grains, bread, vegetables, dairy products, snacks, and the like as well as a shelf to display his products.

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
La socia Maria Antonieta  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida,la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, verduras, arroz y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Member Maria Antonieta continues making her living selling food, and is a hardworking woman who, by means of this business, wants to provide for her family. This member is applying for a loan in order to buy chicken, vegetables, rice, and meat. 

She is happy for the loan and is committed to fulfilling her payment installments.

loans.use: buy chicken, vegetables, rice, and meat.

loans.name: Sharapat

texts.ru: Шарапат, 64 года, замужем, есть дочь и внуки. Образование у нее среднее. Шарапат занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 3 коровы. На 0,74 Га земли выращивает клевер и картофель для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). Шарапат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 коров. Свои доходы она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее улучшение ее бизнеса и постройку сараев для скота.
texts.en:
Sharapat is 64 years old, married,  has a daughter  and is a grandmother. She has received secondary education. Sharapat works as a farmer. She has three cows. She also grows corn and potatoes on a field of 0.74 ha [1.9 acres]. Her monthly revenue is 12,000 soms (KGS). 

Sharapat has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance association for a loan in the amount of 60,000 KGS to buy three cows. She plans to use her revenue for developing her business further and for building cattle sheds.

loans.use: to buy three cows in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Mame Coumba's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 26 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée  le 25 décembre 2010. Il regroupe des femmes du même village qui ont de bonnes relations et qui s'activent principalement dans le commerce, l'embouche, l'aviculture et la transformation.
AISSATOU  debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est âgée de 28 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de  3 garçons .
Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter des habits pour homme et les revendre dans son village. Elle achète 20 complets pour homme à 2500 FCFA l’unité. Elle supporte aussi des charges de transport qui s’élèvent à 4 000 FCFA. Elle revend l’unité à 3500 FCFA.
Les bénéfices récoltés serviront à participer à la dépense quotidienne et aussi à rembourser son prêt.
texts.en: This group of 26 members is a part of the banc villageois that was created on December 25, 2010. It groups together women from the same village who have good relationships and who are principally in commerce, sheep fattening, poultry farming, and transformation. AISSATOU, standing to the right in the photo with her left hand raised, is 28 years old. She is a married mother of three boys. With the loan, she is going to buy men’s clothing and resell them in her village. She buys 20 men’s suits for 2,000 FCFA a piece. She also pays for transportation fees which can be up to 4,000 FCFA. She resells each for 3,500 FCFA. The profits will allow her to help pay for daily expenses and also to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy men's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plates, bowls, thermos bottles, spoons, goblets, etc.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
A variety store is a usual enterprise in the Philippines. The proliferation of this business makes the competition stiff. Store owners try many techniques to make it stable and competitive. Evangeline, age 34, is from Polomolok, South Cotabato, and she adds fruits and vegetables to her inventory to stay competitive. Not only that, she also adds to her income through firewood and charcoal vending. In this way, her income can provide for her family's daily expenditures and the educational costs of her four young children. She is preparing for their college education, so she wants to save as early possible now. In order to do that, she has to improve her store by adding sacks of rice to her inventory. She is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP for this purpose. Part of the loan will be allotted to buy other grocery supplies and beverages. 

In due time, she hopes that her business will progress and will give her family a comfortable life. Evangeline regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and other supplies for her inventory.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Polomolok, South Cotabato is situated in the Southern Mindanao region of the Philippines. It is a first class suburban municipality which has very fertile soil and favorable climate. This is why agricultural crops and livestock production thrive in the area. 

Grace, her husband Silvestre, and their four children reside in this beautiful town of Polomolok. Grace owns a flourishing barbeque stall and pays seven workers to help her. She has many customers who take out barbeque as viand and packed meals. Some customers want to eat in while drinking beer or other beverages. To accommodate them, Grace would like to buy additional chairs and tables for her stall. She needs 50,000 PHP supplementary capital for this purpose. Later on, she can also offer drinks and beverages to match her barbeque. It will surely boost her income and savings to reach her dream of building another structure for business. This will ensure the college education of her four children and a bright future for the whole family. She prays for a happy family where God is the center of their lives. 

Grace is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional chairs and tables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Phai's Group

texts.en:
Phai’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Phai makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sou's Group

texts.en:
Sou’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sou does work as farmer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim  is 49 years old, hardworking woman who has 9 children. She has been providing the service of sewing clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in sewing. Shamim ’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. 

Shamim  has requested for a loan amount 30000 PKR. She intends to use this loan  to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta works helping people with government paperwork. Enriqueta is a divorced woman, she has a son and he helps her at her job that allows them to get more clients.

 Enriqueta is trying to finish the construction of her house and she needs a loan to buy construction materials she hopes you can help her

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Jorge Enrriquez

texts.es:
El socio Jorge Enrriquez  se dedica al negocio de restaurant, el socio es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio el socio quiere sacar adelante a su familia.El socio solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.



El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Communal bank member Jorge Enrriquez works in the restaurant business. He is an entrepreneurial and hard-working person who wants to raise his family through this business. 

He is applying for the loan to purchase cooking ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

He is happy about the loan and promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: Lemune

texts.en:
Lemune is 56 years old and married. In her family she has two children. She is from Imisli. She is successful and very diligent farmer. She has started to work in her field 28 years ago . She buys seeds (fruits and vegetables) from other markets and sows them in her land. People prefer to buy fruits and vegetables from private gardens, because they are naturally raised and cheaper. People know that such products are always fresh and healthy; they are not grown with different pesticides and are not harmful. 

During long years of experience, Lemune was taught how to cover customer`s demands. So, selling fruits and vegetables from houses is popular and cheaper for people than buying them in bazaars and big markets. Her biggest dream is to expand her land and to plant more seeds. But, for this, she has to have some funds. 

With this loan she will purchase more land and sow more seeds. We need Kiva lenders to support Lemune.

loans.use: purchase more land and sow more seeds

loans.name: Eliza

texts.es:
La socia Eliza se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia es una mujer trabjadora y emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Communal bank member Eliza works in the business of selling clothing. She sells pants, blouses, and polo shirts. She is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who wants to raise her family through this business. 

She is applying for the loan to purchase shoes, polo shirts, sweaters, and blouses.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make the payments on her account.

loans.use: to buy shoes, polo shirts, sweaters, and blouses.

loans.name: Gilmar

texts.es:
El socio Gilmar se sigue dedicando al negocio de agencia de viajes, el socio es una persona trabajadora y luchadora que por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante.El socio solicita el crédito para comprar una computadora y sillas para su agencia de viajes.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gilmar continues working in his travel agency business. He is a hardworking and determined person who wants to get ahead through this business. He requests the loan to buy a computer and chairs for his travel agency.

He is happy for the loan and he promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy a computer and chairs for his travel agency.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Food stall businesses require patience. It’s not like office work that starts at 8:00 am and ends at 5:00 pm. Food stall operators go to market early to buy necessary ingredients, endure the heat while cooking, and defy their throbbing body pain after every day of work. 

Shiela, age 40, embarked on her food stall business as an additional income generating venture. Her husband, Zaldy, is a common minimum wage earner whose income doesn’t suffice for their family’s daily needs. Shiela grills barbeque in front of their house so she can earn extra money while taking care of their children. Her regular customers are her neighbors, the local community, students and working people. Profit derived from her business helps a lot in their daily expenditures but she still needs to save a lot for her children’s education. Now she’s planning to cook more barbeque to take advantage of the ongoing school operations. More students are expected to buy from her and it will boost her income. This is why she prays for 18,000 PHP in additional capital that she will use this to buy more ingredients for her barbeque stall. May God knock at your compassionate heart and may you be a blessing to her.

Shiela aspires for her business to grow and her children to finish their schooling to get a better chance to land a more stable job. She gives importance to a harmonious relationship among her family members. She is an inspiration to her co-fellowship members at CCT who regularly meet every week to reflect on God’s Word and share stories about life and their businesses. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her barbeque stall.

loans.name: Edmundo

texts.es:
El socio Edmundo se dedica al trabajo como odontologo,el socio es una persona trabajadora que por medio de este negocio el socio quiere sacar adelante a su familia.El socio solicita el credito para comprar instrumentos de odontologia.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Edmundo works as a dentist. He is a hardworking person who wants to use this business to help his family get ahead. He is requesting this loan to buy dental instruments. 

The member is happy to receive the loan and promises to make the loan payments.

loans.use: To buy dental instruments.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 42 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school. Elena works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell like coffee, egg, milk, sugar, etc.

Elena has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Elena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell like coffee, egg, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy dried coconut meat to sell in her buy-and-sell dried coconut meat business.

Violeta has been in this business for 40 years. Violeta earns more income from raising livestock.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy dried coconut meat to sell in her business

loans.name: Precil

texts.en:
Precil is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with seven children, six of whom attend school.

Precil runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Precil industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like pig fattening.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Precil dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana, de 42 años de edad, estudio solo primer grado, debido a que sus padres murieron cuando ella tenia 6 años de edad y su hermana mayor tuvo que trabajar para sacar adelante a ella y a sus 4 hermanos; ahora está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor, tiene 5 hijos, uno ya se acompaño, solo 4 viven con ellos y estudian solo dos.

Susana, toda su vida ha trabajado en el campo pues no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, una amiga le enseño a abonar y a sembrar; ahora junto a su pareja siembran maíz y pipíanes.- Actualmente, trabajan en una hacienda donde siembran caña de azúcar, su trabajo ahí es limpiar, abonar y sembrar, la hacienda se encuentra a 3 kilómetros de su casa, ella se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. porque a las 5:00 a.m. tiene que salir de casa para llegar a las 6:00 a.m. al trabajo y sale a las 11:00 a.m.

El crédito sera invertido para comprar 2 novillas de repasto.
	
Sus sueños son, que sus últimos 2 hijos se preparen y poder construir su casa de ladrillo.
texts.en:
Susana, who is 42 years old, only went to school through first grade because her parents died when she was six years old and her older sister had to work to raise her and her four siblings. Now she is married, and her husband is a farmer. She has five children. One is already married; only four live with them, and only two go to school.

Susana has worked in the fields all her life, since she didn't have the opportunity to go to school. A friend taught her to fertilize and plant. Now, along with her husband, they raise corn and squash. Now they work at a ranch where they raise sugar cane. Her work there is to clean, fertilize, and plant. The ranch is three kilometers from their house. She gets up at 4:00 a.m. because at 5:00 a.m. she has to leave the house to arrive at 6:00 a.m. for work, and she leaves [her job] at 11:00 a.m.

The loan will be invested in buying 2 heifers to pasture.

Her dreams are that her youngest two children get an education and to be able to build their house of brick.

loans.use: to buy two heifers for grazing.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

Corazon earns a living by farming coconuts in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Corazon supplements this income with earnings from buying and selling root crops and vegetables.

Corazon dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: María Celina

texts.es:
María, de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, ya que sus padres no podían ayudarle más, actualmente es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 2 años de edad, porque su pareja la abandono cuando supo que estaba embarazada; en su casa vive junto a su madre, su hija, sus 3 hermanos y 1 hermana, todos trabajan para llevar el sustento a toda la familia. 

María, se dedica a trabajar como empleada doméstica y también trabaja junto a su familia en la agricultura, actualmente cultivan 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 3,500 metros cuadrados de frijol, el trabajo es familiar, decidieron dedicarse a este rubro, porque así no compraran los granos básicos para su hogar.- Su lugar de trabajo está a 15 minutos de su casa, el terreno donde cultivan es bastante escabroso y tienen que trasladar los fertilizantes en la espalda hasta ese lugar, su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 12:00 del mediodía, ya que por la tarde tiene que ayudar a su madre en los que hacerse del hogar. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar abono, herbicidas y pesticidas para sus cultivos, ya que desean tenerlos en casa para el momento en que sus cultivos lo necesiten aplicarlo y de esta manera asegurar una producción de granos para tener el alimento de la familia.

Ella sueña con poder comprar un terreno y poder construir su casa, ya que desea darle a su hija una casa propia, también desea ayudarle para que estudie.
texts.en:
María is 27 years old. She has a first-grade education, as her parents were unable to help her more. She is currently a single mother of a two-year-old daughter, because her partner abandoned her when he found out that she was pregnant. At home, she lives with her mother, her daughter, her three brothers, and one sister. They all work to put food on the table for the whole family.

María earns her living working as a domestic employee, and she also works with her family in farming. They currently cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn and 3,500 square meters of beans. They work as a family. They decided to work in this field because then they wouldn't have to buy staple grains for their home.

Her place of work is 15 minutes from the house. The land where they farm is quite rugged, and they have to transport the fertilizers there on their backs. Her work schedule is from 6:00 a.m. to noon, because in the afternoon, she has to help her mother with the household chores.

She needs the loan to buy soil amendments, herbicides, and pesticides for their crops, as they would like to have them at home for the moment when the crops need them to be applied, so that they can assure the production of grain to have food for the family.

She dreams of being able to buy a lot and being able to build her house, as she would like to give her daughter a home of her own. She would also like to help her get an education.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, herbicides, and pesticides for her crops.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell fruit and vegetable business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell in her buy-and-sell fruits and vegetables business.

Myrna has been in this business for six years. Myrna earns more income from farming rice and corn.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

Her dream is to save money to expand her business and save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Doris Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Doris del Carmen de 38  años de edad, vive con su esposo  y sus 2 hijos  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 05  años al negocio de venta de mercadería, sus clientes son todos los vecinos y amigos de su comunidad.
Doña Doris del Carmen vive en la ciudad de Pespire  al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Doris del Carmen está solicitando el préstamo para compra de ropa, como calcetines, cuballeras, pantalones, blusas, plásticos, juguetes, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nueva  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  para mejorar sus ganancias y sacar adelante a sus hijos. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras  -  Junio del  2015.
texts.en:
Doris del Carmen, 38 years old, lives with her husband and 2 children in their own home. For the last 5 years she has dedicated her time to her business selling merchandise. Her customers are all her neighbors and friends from her community. 

Doris del Carmen lives in the city of Pespire in southern Honduras. She is a motivated woman who wants to get ahead, and day after day, she strives to improve her quality of life. 

Doris del Carmen is requesting the loan to buy clothing, such as socks, guayabera-style shirts, pants, blouses, plasticware, toys, etc. With the support of this loan, she intends to increase her income and also improve her quality of life. 

She is a new customer who wants to work with Prisma. Her dream is to have a good business and expand her clientele so she can increase her income and provide for her children.  

San Lorenzo, Honduras  -  June 2015.

loans.use: To buy socks, guayabera-style shirts, pants, blouses, plasticware, toys, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
This is Rosela and she's a sari-sari (variety) store owner in Santa Barbara, Iloilo. She's been running her store for 10 years now. She has already experienced different circumstances that really tested her faith. There were times when her capital was almost drained due to huge collectibles. Some of her neighbors pay weeks or months later for the goods they get from her store. Rosela remains strong because this is her way of assisting her driver husband, Lorenzo, in providing for their children’s needs. Two of their children are studying in college.

A sari-sari store is comparable to a convenience store, but it’s smaller and has limited products. Examples of these products are sachets of toiletries, snack items, canned goods, instants, candies, beverages and other commodities. It’s quite advantageous for the people in the community to have an accessible variety store to buy one candy, an egg, and so on. This is the reason why sari-sari stores proliferate in the communities of the Philippines. This is also the reason why the competition becomes stiff. Customers prefer to buy from stores with wide selections and supplies. 

Rosela worries about the competition because she can only offer limited stocks. She appeals for your help through a loan worth 25,000 PHP which she can use to buy more supplies to enhance her store. She aspires to improve her sales to be able to earn more. She dreams that in the near future her business will progress and she can be a general merchant. She wants her children to finish college and obtain a good and stable job. She’s praying for long life, mental and spiritual well-being for her whole family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies to enhance her store.

loans.name: Norma Guadalupe

texts.es:
Norma, de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, está casada y su esposo trabaja en la agricultura y tiene dos hijos que están estudiando.

Norma, desde hace 4 meses trabaja vendiendo ropa de manera ambulante, antes tenia una venta de tortillas, pero cambio su negocio por problemas de salud, a ella le gusta la crianza de ganado y el trabajo en el campo; ahora, junto a su esposo siembran maíz y maicillo.- Por otra parte, ella compra la ropa en San Salvador cada 15 días, ella vende la ropa casa en casa a pie en los caseríos vecinos, su día de trabajo comienza a las 4:30 a.m. ya que hay que prepararle el desayuno a su esposo y luego a las 7:00 sale a vender ropa y regresa  a la 1:00 p.m. porque las tardes la dedica a su familia.

El crédito sera invertido para comprar 4 novillas para repasto.

Su sueño es, llegar a tener un bazar donde pueda vender su ropa.
texts.en:
Norma, 38 years old, studied until the eighth grade. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. She has two children who are studying.

Norma, for the last four months, has worked selling clothing as a street vendor. Before she had a tortilla business, but changed her business due to health issues. She likes raising cattle and working in the field. Now, together with her husband, they grow corn and sorghum. She also buys clothing in San Salvador every 15 days and sells the clothing house to house by foot in the neighboring villages. Her workday starts at 4:30am since she has to prepare breakfast for her husband and later at 7:00am she goes out to sell clothing and returns at 1:00pm because she dedicates her afternoons to her family.

The loan will be invested into buying four heifers for grazing. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell her clothing.

loans.use: to buy four heifers for grazing.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of coconuts business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase additional coconuts to sell.

Analyn has been in this business for five years and earns more income from her general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconut to sell

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora tiene una edad de 54 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que desde hace treinta y cinco años se dedica a la venta de productos básico de primera necesidad en su pequeña tienda la cual esta instalada en su lugar de residencia, con lo cual gracias a sus ganancias que obtiene de su negocio le ayudan para cubrir los gastos necesarios de su vivienda. Teodora con el objetivo de mejorar su casa y que está cada vez se vea más bonita a tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para poder invertir en la compra de lámina, cemento, grava, polines, etc., para poder construir una pequeña galera en el área del corredor de su vivienda la cual actualmente se encuentra desprotegido, al mismo tiempo desea encementar el piso que es de tierra.
texts.en:
Teodora is 54 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She is a hardworking woman who for 35 years has worked selling basic goods in her small store, which is set up in her place of residence. The earnings that she obtains from her business help cover the necessary expenses of her home.

Teodora, with the goal to improve her home so that it is increasingly more beautiful, has made the decision to request a loan from FUSAI to be able to invest in buying metal sheeting, cement, gravel, beams, etc., to be able to build a small gallery in the corridor area of her home where it is currently unprotected. At the same time she wants to cement the floor since it is ground.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, cement, gravel, beams, etc., to roof and cement the corridor area.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is married to Norberto, a retired worker. They live in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental near their grown up children. Josie operates a “sari-sari” or variety store to support and maintain her and her husband’s daily household needs. She also aims to save some amount in case of emergencies because she has no medical benefits and insurance as a self-employed worker. 

In her store, Josie sells dry and packaged commodities with almost all of her products being essential household items and food. She buys these goods at wholesale prices, then sells them by the piece to her neighbors and the local community. This type of store is very common in the Philippines, and the competition is stiff. Josie tries to compete and she wants to enhance her business, so she is applying for a 12,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more grocery items, rice and beverages. This will make her business more stable so she can increase her income. She would appreciate it very much if you can extend your generosity to her. May God return bountiful blessings to you. 

All CCT community clients such as Josie are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items, rice and beverages.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 34 years old, married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like chips, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Mylene has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from buy-and-sell coconut vinegar. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like chips, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn. She is 56 years old and married to Enrique who drives a passenger Jeepney for income. Evelyn runs a variety store and raises hogs in her backyard at the same time. She chose this alternative enterprise because it provides food for the community. Although the return of investment comes after several months, she is happy to provide reasonably priced food for her community in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. She has already advanced considerable amount of capital but her hogs are not yet ready for selling. She has run out of budget for feed, so she is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan. Aside from feed, she will also buy new tires for her husband's passenger Jeepney and extra grocery items for her variety store. 

She hopes you are willing to extend help so she can increase her profit and boost her savings. She is looking forward to having a bigger piggery so she can supply more consumers in her community and nearby areas. Her husband is also working towards buying another jeep that he can rent out to his driver colleague. They are doing all these endeavors for their beloved children who are the source of their inspiration. 

Evelyn prays to God that her whole family will receive salvation from the Lord. She shares her experiences and aspirations to her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative. They regularly meet every week to share stories about their life and businesses and to draw strength from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 57 years old, married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Aurelia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

She has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Aurelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Eden works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Eden is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional bundles of fishing net for her fishing business.

Eden has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of fishing net for her fishing business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a furniture making business in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wood, nails, paints, etc for her furniture making business.

Letecia has been in this business for 8 years now. In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand her business in order to sustain and secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wood, nails, and paints for her furniture making business.

loans.name: Asunción Arnulfo

texts.es:
Arnulfo, de 53 años de edad, es una persona ordenada y eficiente, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casado, su esposa tampoco estudio y se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tienen 5 hijos, 4 de ellos siguen estudiando y uno se dedica a otras actividades económicas.

Arnulfo, sus padres no le pudieron dar la oportunidad para poder estudiar, pero le enseñaron diferentes trabajos en el campo, para poder obtener ingresos económicos y ayudar a su familia; actualmente, está trabajando con un grupo comunal.- En su tiempo libre trabaja en sus cultivos, porque en la zona donde vive, no dispone de otras fuentes de empleo, pero la producción de granos básicos es una buena alternativa, para producir sus propios alimentos y disponer de excedentes para la venta. 

Arnulfo, entiende que los problemas ambientales cada vez son más complicados y que los efectos adversos al buen clima, afectan las producciones agrícolas; es por eso que debe saber muy bien en que fecha es la más adecuada, para la siembra de sus cultivos.- Quiere aprovechar el buen momento de siembra, pero no dispone del dinero suficiente, es por eso que ha decidido solicitar un financiamiento, para comprar semillas, fertilizantes y productos fito-sanitarios, para poder sembrar sus cultivos y disponer del alimento para su familia. 

Los sueños de Arnulfo, son ayudar a sus hijos para que estudien y se desarrollen en la sociedad como profesionales, además quiere mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y colocar un negocio propio donde pueda vender productos de la canasta básica o dedicarse a la crianza de especies menores.
texts.en:
Arnulfo, 53 years old, is an organized and efficient person. He studied until third grade and is married. His wife did not study either and works doing household chores. They have five children and four of them continue studying and one works in other businesses.

Arnulfo’s parents could not give him the opportunity to study, but they taught him different work in the field in order to obtain income and help his family. He is currently working with a communal group. In his free time he works on his crops because in the zone where he lives, there are no other sources of employment. However, producing basic grains is a good alternative in order to produce his own food and have surplus to sell.

Arnulfo understands that environmental problems are increasingly more complex and that the adverse effects to the climate affect agricultural production. That is why he needs to know the best date to plant his crops. He wants to take advantage of the good timing to plant, but he does not have enough money. That is why he has decided to request financing to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide to grow his crops and have food for his family.

Arnulfo’s dreams are to help his children study and develop in society as professionals. In addition, we wants to improve the conditions of his home and have his own business where he can sell staple products or work raising small animals.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide to grow his crops and have food for his family.

loans.name: Maryville

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Maryville works hard to support her family.

She has a entertainment videoke business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a barber shop. Maryville is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for maintenance and add one unit of videoke machine for her entertainment videoke business.

Maryville has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for maintenance and add one unit of videoke machine

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 36 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

Joy has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from raising poultry.

She aspires to save money for expansion of the store and farmland.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Ailicia

texts.en:
Ailicia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like rice, dry goods, noodles, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like raising pigs.

Ailicia dreams that one day she will be able to sustain the needs and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like rice, dry goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa works hard to support her family. Elsa is single and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell.

Elsa has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Elsa would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feeds and vitamins.

She supplements this income with earnings from her farming of sugarcane.

Ronalyn dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is thankful that he was granted a 16,000 PHP loan that he used for maintenance of his tricycle unit. Being a jeepney driver on the road for almost 12 hours not to mention the heavy traffic and humid weather in the Philippines, Alberto bears all this to support his and his wife's daily personal and household needs.

He is again seeking your help for an amount of PHP 19,000 to pay for tire and seat replacement, and maintenance of his jeepney. He values his transportation service for this is his only means of living. He trusts your positive response and is thanking God in advance for your good heart.

Alberto aims to maintain and grow his transportation business. He prays for good health and long life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for tires and seat replacement as well as maintenance of his jeepney unit.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her selling vegetables.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Elisa dreams that one day, she  will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en:
Benon is a married man aged 48 with five children; two attend school. He lives in a rural area with the family and deals in cattle keeping as well as trading and also doing agriculture as a side business. He has been in business since 1991 and works all the seven days of the week and 14 hours per day. He started the business to improve the family income and to get school fees for the children.

He acquired the loan to purchase more cows for the business. These will increase his income since he is assured of customers from the area.

His hope for the future is to be the leading supplier of cows in his community, and the challenge he faces is poor weather conditions leading to poor pastures. He describes himself as an honest and hardworking man who appreciates the kindness of the lenders.

loans.use: to boost his cattle trade business by buying additional cows

loans.name: Mukhtar

texts.en:
Mukhtar is 24 years old and he is single. Mukhtar  has been working in a pharmacy for the last five years. Mukhtar and his older brother are in nursing, and they have a pharmacy in Hargeisa. He studies at the Gollis University, especially in the area of civil engineering. 

Mukhtar requested a loan of $1,000 from the Kaaba Microfinance Institution to buy more medicines or drugs to expand his pharmacy. In the future, Mukhtar wants to open onother pharmacy in Hargeisa.

loans.use: to expand his pharmacy

loans.name: Victoire

texts.fr: Victoire est une femme mariée âgée de 30 ans habitant à Baguida avec ses deux enfants à charge. Victoire est une revendeuse ambulante de fruits qui achète ses marchandises au marché quatre fois par mois. Victoire demande ce prêt pour commander des fruits afin de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière élevée pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation.
texts.en:
Victoire is thirty years old, married and lives in Baguida.  She is responsible for two children.  Victoire sells fruit on foot and buys her supplies four times a month from the market.

She has requested this loan to buy more fruit to satisfy the demands of her customers.  Her increased financial independence will help her to provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of avocados, 3 baskets of bananas and 1 sack of oranges for sale.

loans.name: Mashudah

texts.en: Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Mashudah, one of Ruma’s agents. She lives in Indonesia’s capital, Jakarta. She is married with two children and owns a stall where she sells snacks, drinks, and mobile airtime credits. Mashudah joined Ruma because she wants to learn more about running a business. Mashudah requests a loan to buy mobile airtime credits to resell. Mashudah thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to buy mobile airtime credits to sell.

loans.name: Judithe

texts.fr: Agée de 27 ans, Judithe est une femme mariée vivant à Baguida. Judithe a un enfant à charge et exerce comme activité, la vente de produits de beautés dans les quartiers environnant. Judithe achète ses marchandises au marché trois fois par mois. Pour bien tirer une bonne rentabilité de son commerce afin d’orienter l’éducation de son enfant, Judithe sollicite ce prêt pour en faire bon usage.
texts.en:
Judithe is twenty-seven years old, married and lives in Baguida.  She is responsible for one child.  Judithe sells beauty products in her neighbourhood.  She buys new supplies three times a month from the market.

Judithe has requested this loan so she can increase her earnings and provide more money for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy various hair accessories for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 15 boxes of hinges, sealant, paint, brake fluid and hydraulics for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies of cosmetic products and makeup.

loans.name: Tukaze Mwendo Group

texts.fr: Jean Baptiste est commerçant, président de la banque villageoise Tukaze Mwendo, client de l’IMF Hekima, âgé de 39 ans, père de 6 enfants dont 5 vont à l’école et 1 est encore gosse. Il est propriétaire d’un magasin d'habillements non loin du centre commercial depuis 10 ans. Il commença son busines avec de fonds reçu de son decompte final. Il va s’approvisionner en divers habillements dames. Il souhaite accroitre son activité, acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, il remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is a small retailer and president of the 'Banc Villageois' Tukaze Mwendo, which works with the field partner, Hekima.  He is thirty-nine years old and father to six children, five of whom attend school and one is too young.

Jean Baptiste has owned and run a clothing shop, not far from the commercial centre, for ten years.    He began his business with funds received from a compensation payment.  He plans to use his loan to buy various items of women's clothing for sale in his shop.  In the future, he would like to expand his business, buy a plot of land, educate and feed his children.

Jean Baptiste is grateful to Hekima for the support they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy various items of clothing for women for resale.

loans.name: Beo Neere Group

texts.fr:
Habibata est une jeune femme mariée agée de 38 ans et mère de 03 enfants. elle à une grande expérience dans la vente des pagnes. ce qui fait le succès de son activité c'est ca stratégie de vente. Elle se déplace dans les services pour vendre avec les agents des services en plus elle dépose dans les alimentations pour exposition. Elle à déjà bénéficié de 2 fois le crédit à ACFIME et bien remboursée.
Elle à besoin du crédit pour acheter 20 pièces de pagnes.
texts.en:
Habibata is thirty-eight years old, married and moher to three children.  She has a great deal of experience selling pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) which contributes to the success of her business.  She sells the pagnes directly to office workers and also exhibits them in various food shops to gain orders.

Habibata has already had two loans with the field partner, ACFIME, which she repaid fully.  This loan will enable her to buy twenty pagnes for sale.

loans.use: to buy 20 pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for sale.

loans.name: Twizamure Group

texts.fr:
François   fait partie du groupe  Twizamure  et  habite à  Gitega. Il a 65 ans et est marié à Vénérande, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 9 enfants âgés de 22 à 43 ans dont  2 étudient.

Il fait le commerce des ustensiles de cuisine  depuis 20 ans. 

Il  est à son septième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’ustensiles de cuisine  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait acheter un terrain cultivable et voir ses enfants étudier.


.
texts.en:
François is a member of the Twizamure Group and lives in Gitega.  He is sixty-five years old and married to Vénérande who is a farmer.  Together they have nine children aged from twenty-two to forty-three years old.  Two of their children are studying.  He has been selling kitchen utensils for twenty years.

This will be the seventh loan for François with the field partner, Turame.  It will increase his working capital and enable him to buy many kitchen utensils and incease his earnings.

In the coming years, François would like to buy a plot of agricultural land and see his children study.

loans.use: to increase his working capital and buy many kitchen utensils for sale.

loans.name: Akpéné

texts.fr: Akpéné est une femme mariée de 26 ans qui vit à Baguida avec son enfant. Akpéné vend des fruits à la devanture de sa boutique. Akpéné s’approvisionne au marché trois fois par mois. Akpéné demande ce prêt pour acheter des fruits et gagner plus de bénéfice pour venir en aide aux diverses charges quotidiennes éprouvées.
texts.en:
Akpéné is twenty-six years old, married and lives in Baguida with her child.  She sells fruit from the front of her shop.  Three times a month she goes to the market to buy new supplies.

Akpéné has requested this loan to buy more fruit which will increase her profits.  This will help her provide for the regular day-to-day expenses of her family.

loans.use: to buy 1 basket of pineapples, 2 baskets of bananas and 1 basket of papayas for sale.

loans.name: Reyna Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Reina  de 30  años de edad, vive con su mama  y sus 2 hijas  en casa propia, se dedica desde hace 08  años al negocio de venta de pollo frito, refrescos, jugos, agua purificada y como tacos, enchiladas, pastelitos, yuca frita, y tajaditas, sus clientes son todas las personas amigos y vecinos de su comunidad.
Doña Reina es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de pollo, refrescos, carnes, plátanos, queso, tortillas, etc. y también quiere comprar un frízer nuevo para mejorar su negocio,  con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es una cliente nueva  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo seguir invirtiendo en la construcción de su casa nueva.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Junio del 2015.
texts.en:
Reina, 30, lives with her mother and two daughters in her own house.  For eight years she has been running a business selling fried chicken, soft drinks, juices, mineral water and tacos, enchiladas, pastries, fried yucca and banana fritters to her customers who are friends and neighbors in her community.

Reina is an entrepreneur with a desire to get ahead and she struggles daily to improve her quality of life.  She is requesting a loan to buy chicken, soft drinks, meats, bananas, cheese, tortillas, etc. and also buy a new freezer to improve her business. With the help of the loan she hopes to increase her income and improve her quality of life.

She is a new client who wants to to work with Prisma.  Her dream is to have a better business and increase her customer base while also investing in the construction of a new house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June, 2015

loans.use: To buy chicken, soft drinks, meats, bananas, cheese, tortillas, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rebecca works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional bundles of fishing nets for her fishing business.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fishing nets.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy materials like linen, threads, zippers, etc for her tailoring business.

Arsenia has been in this business for 48 years. Arsenia earns additional income from buying and selling rice and charcoal and pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like linen, threads and zippers.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Prima works hard to support her family.

She has a beauty parlor business in the Philippines, she also earns additional income from raising pigs. Prima is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional products for her beauty salon business.

Prima has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Ma. Julita

texts.en:
Ma. Julita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with seven children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her fishing. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Ma. Julita dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to purchase more ingredients like noodles, spices, vegetables, meat, etc for her restaurant business.

Elsie has been in this business for two years. Elsie earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients like noodles, spices, vegetables and meat.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a bamboo weaving business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo to weave.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a general store, raising pigs and buying and selling charcoal.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Jenelyn dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo to weave.

loans.name: Merlin Nacenis

texts.es:
Merlín, de 26 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, estudio hasta primer grado, tuvo que abandonar los estudios, porque sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a trabajar como agricultor y jornalero, tienen 3 hijos y están estudiando.

Merlín, se dedica a los oficios del hogar y cuida una pequeña parcela de maíz que tiene sembrada cerca de su casa, el trabajo en el campo lo realiza con su esposo y su hija mayor en la tarde. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar abono, herbicidas y plaguicidas para aplicárselos a sus cultivos, los cuales comenzaran a cultivar el otro mes, ella quiere comprarlos con anticipación, para conseguirlos a un precio más bajo.

Ella, desea poder darle a sus dos hijas y a su hijo la educación que ella no pudo recibir, debido a la falta de recursos económicos, además desea tener una producción muy buena y que los esfuerzos que está realizando sean recompensados obteniendo una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Merlin, 26, is a homemaker and has a first grade education.  She had to quit school because her parents a low income.  She has a common-law husband who works as a farmer and day laborer.  They have three children who attend school.

Merlin takes care of the home and of the small cornfield near her house.  She and her husband work together caring for the crops and the eldest daughter helps in the afternoons.

The loan is needed to buy fertilizer, herbicides and pest control agents for the crops which they will plant next month.  She plans to buy the supplies ahead of time to pay a better price for them.

She wants to give her two daughters and son the education she was unable to receive due to lack of resources.  She also wants to obtain an abundant production so her efforts are compensated at harvest time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, herbicides and pest control agents for her crops.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es: José de 25 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos menores de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios de seguridad desde hace nueve años y gracias a su sueldo devengado logra sacar adelante a su familia. José desea realizar el cabio de techo de su vivienda ya que el que posee actualmente se encuentra deteriorado y tiene el temor que para el próximo invierno le pueda provocar pérdidas materiales debido a las filtraciones de gua que se le puedan presentar, es por esta razón  que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina, polines, y pines para hacer la mejora antes mencionada a su vivienda
texts.en:
Jose, 25, lives with his life partner and two minor children.  He is a hard-working man who earns a living as a security guard.  He has been employed for nine years and, thanks to his salary, is able to provide for his family.  

Jose wants to change the roof of his house since it is deteriorated; he is afraid that next winter some of the material might be damaged by water leakage.  Therefore he is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy metal sheeting, beams and nails to improve the roof.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, beams, and nails to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Marly Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Marly de 39  años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos que dependen de él, tiene casa propia, se dedica desde hace 08  años al negocio de venta de medicinas por mayor y también al por menor, sus clientes son personas de las comunidades y caseríos de la zona, quienes cuentan en su mayoría con sus negocios.
Don Marly vende toda clase de pastillas, jarabes, vitaminas, inyecciones de varias, sueros, y tratamientos para algunas enfermedades es un hombre emprendedor con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de medicinas como pastillas, vitaminas, jarabes, sueros, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo el pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  para mejorar sus ganancias y poder más pronto comprarse otro carro más nuevo para trabajar. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras -   Junio del  2015.
texts.en:
Marly, 39, lives with his wife and his two dependent children.  He has his own home and for eight years has been selling wholesale and retail medicines.  His customers are residents in the communities and rural areas who, mainly, run their own businesses.

Marly sells all kinds of pills, syrups, vitamins, injectables, serums and treatment for different illnesses.  He is an entrepreneur who wants to get ahead, struggling every day to improve his quality of life.

He is requesting a loan to buy medicines such as pills, vitamins, syrups, serums, etc.  With the help of the loan he hopes to improve his income and quality of life.  He is a new client who is excited about working with Prisma.

His dream is to run a good business and increase his customer base to increase income and buy a new car soon for his work.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - June, 2015

loans.use: To buy pills, vitamins, syrups, serums, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Asela

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Asela works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Asela is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wood, nails, bamboo, etc for her furniture shop business.

Asela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wood, nails and bamboo.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios works hard to support four children. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 6,750 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Remedios is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Lucinia

texts.es:
Lucinia, de 48 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, dejo de estudiar debido al conflicto armando, ya que las fuerzas opositoras cerraron las escuelas y ella no pudo continuar con sus estudios; ahora, está casada desde hace 30 años, su esposos se dedica a trabajar como agricultor y es comerciante de ganado, tiene 5 hijas, de las cuales todas han estudiado hasta bachillerato, tres de ellas ya formaron su propia familia y las 2 menores trabajan en una venta de ropa y le ayudan con los gastos del hogar.

Lucinia, se dedica a los oficios del hogar y a atender una tienda que tienen como familia desde hace muchos años, también tienen un molino de nixtamal, el cual también tiene que atender ella; su hija antes y después de llegar a la casa le ayuda a darles de comer a unos pollos que tienen y a unos cerdos también, los cuales tiene en para luego ser vendidos.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar más mercadería para su tienda, porque hay personas que demandan artículos que ella no tiene y que comprándolos podrá tener un mejor margen de venta y asegurarse un ingreso mayor en las ganancias y con una parte de este crédito, comprara concentrado para 3 cerdos que tiene, los cuales ya están listos para venderlos.

Lucinia, sueña con poder construir un pequeño garaje, porque tiene un vehículo y tiene que dejarlo afuera de su casa y con el sol y el agua y la lluvia se le daña la pintura.
texts.en:
Lucinia, 48, has a fifth grade education, but due to the armed conflict she was unable to continue her education because the opposing forces closed the schools.  Now, she has been married for 30 years and her husband works as a farmer and cattle merchant.  She has five daughters and all of them finished high school.  Three have their own families and the youngest two work selling clothing and help with the household expenses.

Lucinia is a homemaker and also runs a store the family has had for several years.  She also has a corn mill which she runs.  Her daughter helps before and after her daily activity by feeding the chickens and pigs they raise to sell.

She needs a loan to buy goods for the store because many customers are asking for things she does not have on hand.  If she buys them she will improve her sales margin and earn more profit.  With part of the loan she will buy feed for her three pgis which are ready to sell.

Lucinia dreams of building a small garage for the vehicle she has which has to be parked outside in the sun and rain which damage the paint.

loans.use: To buy goods for her store.

loans.name: Abeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Abeth works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Abeth is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish vending business.

Abeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell in her fruits and vegetables business.

Betty has been in this business for 5 years. Betty earns additional income from a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business and also enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Jovelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pre-paid mobile load. Jovelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds and vitamins for her pig fattening business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Jovelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 38 years old, married and has three children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Ellen has borrowed and paid back 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en:
Emilda is 45 years old, married and works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  Emilda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wood, nails, paints, etc for her furniture shop business.

Emilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wood, nails and paints.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, abandonó los estudios porque sus padres no le pudieron ayudar más y fue por esa razón que tuvo que dedicarse a trabajar como agricultor y cuando obtuvo la mayoría de edad se fue a prestar servicio militar, actualmente está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar y tiene una niña de 2 años de edad.

Carlos, se dedica a laborar como vigilante privado en una zona residencial, sus turnos son de 24 horas, él ingresa a trabajar a las 8:00 a.m. de un día y sale a las 8:00 a.m. del día siguiente, para estar a esa hora tiene que salir de su casa a las 4:30 a.m. porque camina 30 minutos hasta donde toma el bus y el viaje dura 2:00 horas y tiene que tomar otro bus en el cual viaja otros 20 minutos para llegar a su trabajo, en sus días de descanso se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, la cual le sirve para el alimento de su familia.

Carlos, necesita el crédito para comprar abono, plaguicidas y pesticidas para sus cultivos de maíz y frijol, teniendo estos productos, podrá aplicarlos en el tiempo cuando sean requeridos por los cultivos, también como el pasa poco tiempo en su casa pagara mano de obra, para que le ayuden a cultivar la tierra.

El sueño de Carlos es, poder construir su casa de un material más fuerte, ya que en la que vive actualmente es de adobe y la quiere construir de ladrillo, además desea darle a su hija la educación que ella se merece y que crezca en un lugar sano.
texts.en:
Carlos, 24, studied until third grade and then left school because his parents couldn't support him any more. This is why he decided to make a living working as a farmer and when he came of age he signed up for military service. He is now in a relationship. His partner takes care of household tasks and they have a two-year-old daughter. 

Carlos is a private security guard in a residential area. He works 24 hour shifts: he starts work at 8:00 am and leaves at 8:00 am the next day. In order to get there at this time he has to leave his house at 4:30 am because he walks 30 minutes to the bus stop and then has a bus journey of two hours followed by another one which lasts 20 minutes in order to get to work. On his days off he works on the farm, which allows him to feed his family. 

Carlos needs this loan to buy fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides for his corn and bean crops. When he gets these products he will be able to use them on his crops when they need them. As he is not often at home he will also pay for a workforce to help him work the land. 

Carlos dreams of being able to build his house out of a stronger material. His house is currently made of mud brick and he would like to build it out of brick. He also wants to give his daughter the education that she deserves and wants her to grow up in a safe place.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides for his corn and bean crops

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Rowena is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to by additional fish to sell in her fish business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 39 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Arceli Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Arceli Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables and raising pigs.  Arceli Josephine is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to  purchase more stocks of household goods to sell in her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Arceli Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household gods to sell.

loans.name: Glorygen

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Glorygen works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, she also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Glorygen is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy a fishing net for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Glorygen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net for her business.

loans.name: Sabastian

texts.en:
Sabastian is 29 years old and a farmer in the rural area. He operates a retail shop to supplement his income. 

He has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to buy stock for his retail business.  He started the business in 2011 with high hopes of earning income to look after his family. He is also earns a salary to supplement his monthly income. His business is located in the Kakoni Kyamuhunga Bushenyi District, and his customers are people in Kyamuhunga.

He is an honest man who works 10 hours a day, 6 days a week, but he faces the challenge of competition. He is determined to boost his business after getting the loan and to achieve his long-term dream of becoming financially stable and starting a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy retail stock to sell

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en:
Eleanor works hard to support her family. Eleanor is married and has a buy and sell charcoal and coconut business in the Philippines. Eleanor has been in this business for five years now.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal and coconut to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal and coconut  to sell

loans.name: Dyah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders!  Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma agents, Dyah. 

Dyah lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She is happily married. She owns and manages a stall that sells small snacks, drinks, and mobile airtime credits for her community. She decided to join Ruma because she wanted to try another business opportunity, as well as contribute more to her community. Dyah is happy she joined Ruma because she can get a lot of knowledge about how to manage a business. 

As her business grows, Dyah is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. 

Your loan will be very useful to help Dyah improve her business and, accordingly, her community, which needs access to such services. 

Dyah's goal in the near future is to build an e-commerce business for her community aroun, Ruma's latest product, which is called "Mapan."  Her community can have better products with lower prices. Dyah thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments for her community.

loans.name: Muspiroh

texts.en:
Muspiroh lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She is happily married and she and her husband have two children.

She sells mobile airtime credits for her community. She decided to join Ruma because she wanted to try another business opportunity, as well as contribute more to her community.
