Riza dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers as well as a flower pot and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Alfredo Antonio

texts.en:
Alfredo is 52 years old and is the father of 4; he lives in the municipality of San Antonio de Urabá in the northwest of Antioquia which had been a place where the Colombian war took place and let everybody suffering the consequences. Nowadays people are trying to reestablish their lives, and Alfredo is one of them. He has a farm where he raises cattle and grows different kind of products, job that he’s being doing for more than 15 years. 

He works really hard to support his family and to see his business grow, that´s why he wants to invest in it, so he increases his grow, be sustainable, can offer different products and make more profits. He asked for a loan so he can buy fertilizers, agrochemicals and others, so it will help with his grow and with the food for his animals. 

He dreams with having his own house because he hasn’t one right now. He is a committed and responsible man who wants to do better in life, to improve his business and to do great things with it. You can help Alfredo with a loan that will get him closer to his dreams.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, agrochemicals and others

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 57 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a retail gasoline business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

Cecilia has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the retail gasoline business for nine years and also earns an income from food vending.

Cecilia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Renalyn is 41 years old, and four of her children are in school.

Renalyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Renalyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Renalyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Renalyn would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

Genara is 44 years old and married with six children, four of whom are in school.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Genara is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feeds and rice bran.

Genara has been pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feeds and rice bran

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 50 years old and single.

Shirly is in the agricultural business of buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Shirly requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to sell.

Shirly has been buying and selling livestock for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Shirly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Josefina works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of rice business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from food vending. Josefina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy-and-sell rice business.

Josefina has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rodelyn is 25 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Rodelyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Rodelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

Rodelyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Rodelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Husin

texts.en:
Husin is a 49-year-old, married man from Rafah city, located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. However, he wants to improve his family's standard of living to help them live more comfortably.

Husin took a USD loan from FATEN in order to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Husin will be able heat water more efficiently, enabling the family to take warm showers, while also decreasing the electricity expenses. 

Husin appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy motor parts for motor repair

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Sherly works hard to support her family.

Sherly has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines; she also earns additional income from fattening pigs.  Sherly is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell in her buy-and-sell rice business.

Sherly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 47 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Dolores has a general store business in the Philippines. Dolores requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Dolores has been in this business for five years. In the future, Dolores would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
Cruz es uno de los hombres que ama y protege a su familia, él es casado tiene una linda familia de seis hijos de las edades entre 4 y 16 años, y ellos viven en una comunidad denominada Nahuala.
Cruz para que a su familia no le haga falta nada se dedica a dos actividades su primer labor es que trabaja como albañil con el que ya tiene 20 años de ejércelo y es su mayor fuente de ingresos, y su segunda actividad es que trabaja como sastre pero en su tiempo libre asiste con su grupo musical, con este esfuerzo que el día con día realiza, su familia ha sacado adelante; a Cruz desde  hace mucho le ha preocupado que su familia no cuente con un hogar digno, pero a pesar de todos sus esfuerzos no le ha sido posible construir su casa, por lo que ahora para poder conseguir y hacer posible esta necesidad ha decidido solicitar un crédito para comprar cemento, cal, arena hierro y block.
Cruz se esmera día con día es su trabajo para poder pagar sus cuotas  del crédito y que su casa este antes de finalizar el año, para que su familia tenga su casa digna. Pero sueña también comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Cruz is one of those men who loves to protect his family. He is married and has a lovely family with six children between the ages of 4 and 16. They live in a community called Nahuala. Cruz devotes himself to two business activities so that his family will not be in need. His first job is working as a bricklayer, which he has been doing for 20 years. It is his biggest source of income. His second business activity is working as a tailor. In his free time he is in a musical group. With this effort that he makes day to day his family has gotten ahead.

For a long time Cruz has worried that his family does not have a decent house. In spite of all of his efforts, it has not been possible for him to build his house. Therefore, in order to now be able to do that and make this necessity possible, he has decided to request a loan. He will use the loan to buy cement, lime powder, sand, iron, and cement blocks.

Cruz puts forth great effort in his work day after day in order to be able to make his loan payments and to build his house before the end of the year. He does this so that his family will have a decent house. He also dreams of buying a car.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement, lime powder, sand, iron, and cement blocks.

loans.name: Leony

texts.en:
Leony is 38 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Leony is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and pay for laborers' salaries.

Leony has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and pay for laborers' salaries

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 49 years old and married with two children.

Jonalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Jonalyn has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Jonalyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rhea

As a married parent of two children, Rhea works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from farming rice.  Rhea is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell for her business.

Rhea has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nazarbegim

texts.ru: Не каждый может похвастаться, что его утро начинается со свежих и горячих, выпеченных с любовью лепешек. Назарбегим не только может довольствоваться вкусом несравненных лепешек, но и делится с этим вкусом с другими. Назарбегим просыпается рано утром, чтобы к рассвету все лепешки были на прилавке. Назарбегим старается быстро продать лепешки пока они горячие и ей это удается. Она имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Количество клиентов растет и соответственно растет потребность к ее товару. Она решила расширить деятельность и увеличить объем товара. Для этой операции Назарбегим просит поддержку. Она собирается купить больше лепешек на продажу. Она уверена, что у нее все получится, если ей немного помогут, и благодарит за понимание.
texts.en:
Not many people can brag that their morning starts off with fresh, hot flatbread, baked with love. Nazarbegim does not only get to enjoy the incomparable taste of the flatbread but she also gets to share this taste with others. 
She wakes up early in the morning, so the flatbread can be on the counter by sunrise. Nazarbegim tries to sell her flatbread while it's still hot and she manages to do it. She has regular customers, and her customer base keeps growing. Respectively also the demand for her merchandize is rising. So Nazarbegim has decided to expand her business and increase the volumes. For this she is asking for support. She wants to buy more flatbread to sell. Nazarbegim is sure that she will succeed, if she gets some help, and she is grateful for your attention.  .

loans.use: to buy flatbread and expand the business

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 65 years old, widow with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Aida has a food vending business in the Philippines. Aida requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Aida has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Aida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Sepora has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Sepora requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Sepora has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Sepora would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 29 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Mary Jane is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Mary Jane has been raising livestock for nine years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Sylvia

Sylvia is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Sylvia requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

Sylvia has been fattening pigs for three years now and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Sylvia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:

Jocelyn has a buy-and-sell herbal medicine business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of herbal medicines to offer for sale.

Jocelyn has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of herbal medicines to offer for sale.

loans.name: Abanyamugisha Group

texts.en:
ABANYAMUGISHA is a group led by Alice who is 36 years old. The group name means “Blessed people” in English. She has been a group leader for 1 years. She sells clothes and has been selling in a business for 4 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more shirts and dresses for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy medical insurance and improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy more shirts and dresses for sale.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marina is 63 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Marina has a general store business in the Philippines. Marina requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Marina has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Marina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Preciosa

texts.en:
Preciosa is 54 years old and married with four children.  With one child in school, Preciosa works very hard to provide for them.

Preciosa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Preciosa has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good and other groceries. 

In the future Preciosa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nelsie

texts.en:

Nelsie is requesting her eighth loan from NWTF for 19,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more clothing to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Ansar

texts.en:
Ansar  is 46 years old, married woman. She is a mother of 6 children. Years ago she started her own business of selling animals for meeting her household expenses.  Ansar counts a good client list and makes good amount of income to support her family. 

Now, she has requested for a loan of 30000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount  to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires of improving her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Hammuda

texts.en:
Hammuda is 27 years old and married. He is from Rafah City, located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income. This income barely covers the family needs. 

Hammuda requested a loan from FATEN, which he will use to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. With this loan, he will be able heat water more efficiently and enable the family to take warm showers, while decreasing the electricity expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is 24 years old and married. He is from Rafah City, located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income. This income is barely covers all the family needs. 

Khaled requested a loan from FATEN, which he will user to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. With this loan, he will be able heat water more efficiently and enable the family to take warm showers, while also to decreasing the electricity expenses.

loans.use: to pruchase a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Gigie

texts.en:
Gigie is 45 years old and married. She has four children, three of whom go to school.

Gigie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional inventory of groceries to sell.

Gigie has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from an Avon dealership.

Gigie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Baby Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Baby Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Baby Jane is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net for her fishing business.

Baby Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net

loans.name: Alonzo

texts.es:
Alonzo es un hombre de 58 años, vive en una comunidad de Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán, él tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de los cuales dos de ellos son mayores de edad y la última estudia segundo básico.
Alonzo  por tener la dicha de vivir en una de las zonas más fértiles y que es conocida por la buena producción de café y banano que produce, él trabaja como agricultor  cosechando café y banano, con esta labor lleva el 25 años, gracias a sus años de experiencia cosecha una variedad de banano y café, Alonzo es uno de los pocos agricultores que cuida y protege la naturaleza, pero él con la ilusión de ir aumentando su cultivo ha tomado la iniciativa de solicitar un crédito que lo utilizara para la compra de media cuerda de terreno que próximamente lo utilizara para su cultivo.
Alonzo guarda las esperanzas de poder comprar el terreno porque uno de sus más grandes sueños es incrementar su cultivo para obtener mejores ganancias e instalar un negocio de compra y venta de banano.
texts.en:
Alonzo, age 58, lives in a community in Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán. He has a lovely family with three children. Two of them are adults, and the last one is secondary school. Alonzo, having the good fortune to live in one of the most fertile areas, is known for his good coffee and banana production. He has worked as a farmer, harvesting coffee and bananas, for 25 years. Thanks to his years of experience, he harvests a variety of bananas and coffee.

Alonzo is one of the few farmers who cares for and protects nature. In order to increase his crops, he has taken the initiative to request a loan. He will use the loan to buy half a 'cuerda' [land measurement] of land that he will then cultivate. Alonzo hopes to be able to buy the land because one of his biggest dreams is to increase his crops in order to get better earnings and to set up a business of buying and selling bananas.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to cultivate.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru:
Гулнора 39 летняя жительница из городка Куляб. Она замужем за мигранта. У них в браке имеется трое замечательных детей. Она успевает заниматься домашними делами и ухаживать за детьми. Гулнора также успевает дома заниматься шитьем. 
  Сейчас в доме Гулноры ремонт, она временно не работает и следит за процессом работы. Ее средств не хватает для завершения ремонта, и она просит ей помочь. Ей нужно оплатить услуги рабочих строителей и купить кирпичи. Она надеется, что ее поддержат и благодарт за поддержку.
texts.en:
Gulnora is a 39-year old inhabitant of the town of Kulob. Her husband is a migrant. They have three wonderful children. Gulnora takes care of the household and raises children. She also manages to take in sewing orders to work on at home.

At present Gulnora temporarily does not work as there are renovations being done in her home and she manages this process. She lacks the means to complete renovations and is asking for help. She needs to pay for the contractor’s labor costs and buy bricks. She hopes to obtain support and is grateful in advance.

loans.use: to pay for bricks and construction labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family's house.

loans.name: Grupo Chuimaza Las Cristinas Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 28 años de edad, ella vive junto a su familia en una comunidad de  la aldea Xejuyup, Maria tiene un hijo de nueve años.
Maria (es la primera que aparece del lado izquierdo en la foto) es una mujer que lucha cada día para apoyar a su familia, pues desde hace ocho años se dedica a la elaboración de güipiles típicos, le gusta esta actividad ya que lo hace desde la comunidad de su casa, y esto le permite también realizar los oficios de su casa y cuidar de sus hijos, con esta actividad ella contribuye con los gastos de casa.
Maria con el afán de seguir elaborando sus güipiles, ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de hilos, de tipo seda, alemán, y lustrina para que los güipiles tengan la mejor combinación de  hilos. Maria tiene el sueño de construir su casa para que sus hijos vivan mejor.
texts.en:
María is twenty-eight years old and lives with her family in the village community of Xejuyup. She has a nine-year-old son. 

María (first on the left in the photo), is a woman who fights to support her family every day, as she has been making traditional güipiles [traditional Guatemalan dresses] for eight years.  She likes this work because she can do it at home, which allows her to also do the housework and care for her children. She contributes to the household expenses by doing this work.

María wants to continue making her güipiles, so she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of silk thread, German embroidery thread, and embroidery floss, so that the qüipiles may have a better combination of threads.

María has the dream of building a house so that her children may live better.

loans.use: to purchase thread in order to make traditional Guatemalan dresses.

loans.name: Anonymous

loans.name: Alla Kasabaouyouma Group

texts.fr: Fatimata, est âgée de 44 ans mariée mère de 2 enfants, elle exerce son activité de vente de zinzinbre , savon traditionnels depuis dix (10) ans. Elle est installée à coté d’un marché où elle reçoit beaucoup de commandes,  son expérience dans l’activité et l’emplacement son lieu de commerce est un atout pour elle de faire marcher son activité. Elle veux le prêt pour s’acheter 20 sacs de zinzinbre et 10 sacs de savons traditionnel. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 7 fois  à ACFIME et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Fatimata is 44 years old, married and has two children. She has been selling ginger and traditional soaps for ten years. She sets up her wares in a corner of the market where she gets a lot of customer traffic. Her business experience and the location of her sales stand help her keep her business going. 

Fatimata is seeking this loan to buy 20 bags of ginger and 10 bags of traditional soap. She already received seven loans from ACIME in the past and repaid them on time.

loans.use: to buy 20 50-kg bags of ginger at 8,000 francs per bag as well as soap.

Her husband is a occasional builder in Russia and helps Valentina  in managing this farm.
 
This hard-working farmer wants to develop her business around the cows, goats and chickens that she owns and increase her income as well as improve the conditions her animals are living in.
Valentina will use the loan to build a new stable for cows and goats and extend by this mean her farm's capacities.

Her sport center has a soccer team played by young children, she is the coach.

She is asking for $13,500.00 (thirteen thousand five hundred pesos) to develop a summer sports-project.  She is willing to buy uniforms for her soccer team, swimming equipment and she also wants to rent some vans for the team transportation.

loans.name: Maria Isidora

texts.es:
Maria Isidora tiene 57 años de edad,conviviente, vive con su esposo en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

María Isidora se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 05 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Maria Isidora espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María Isidora is 57 years old and lives with her husband in a rural area in the district of Cayaltí, which is located in Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region, along the northern coast of Peru. Most of the people in the area are farmers, ranchers, or tradespeople.

María Isidora is in the business of raising and selling young animals, including chickens, hens, ducks, turkeys, and more. She runs her business out of her home and has five years of experience. She has very good personal and professional references from people in the area. This loan will be used to buy a greater number of the animals she raises as well as nutritiously balanced feed for them. With this, María Isidora hopes to provide a better product to her customers, enabling her to earn more income, and eventually improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: purchase assorted fowl and nutritious feed for them

texts.es:
Las metas son el  motor que impulsa a una persona para mejorar su vida, Valeska es testigo de esto, pues ella es  una joven de 25 años, independiente, soñadora, perseverante, que siempre se traza objetivos firmes que la ayudan a mejorar su calidad de vida. En la actualidad, está a un paso de graduarse como licenciada en Contabilidad, sin embargo llegar esto no le ha sido nada fácil, porque ha tenido que trabajar y estudiar a la vez para pagar sus estudios.

Por ello, solicita un crédito para pagar los gastos de su titulación y un módulo de graduación. Ella se siente muy orgullosa de todo los logros que ha obtenido, incluyendo, su título universitario. Cabe destacar, que ella Valeska planea estudiar una especialización y ahorrar para una vivienda.
texts.en:
Goals are the motor that drives a person to improve their lives. Valeska is testimony to that. At 25 years old, she is independent, a dreamer and persevering and has always had firm objectives which help her improve her quality of living. At present she is one step away from graduating with a degree in Accounting. However getting there has not been easy as she had to work and study at the same time to pay for her studies.

So she is requesting a loan to pay for the expenses of obtaining her degree and her final course work. She feels very proud of all the achievements she has obtained including her university degree. It is worth noting that Valeska is planning to take further specialization and save for a house.

loans.use: to pay for final course work and her graduating expenses.

loans.name: Juan Estuardo

texts.es:
Juan es un joven de 26 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el Departamento de Suchitepéquez. Él es un joven emprendedor, comenta que trabaja como maestro de educación primaria contribuyendo al desarrollo de su comunidad, esta actividad lo realiza en la escuela que se ubica en su comunidad, a través de esta labor obtiene un ingreso que le permite cubrir sus gastos de la universidad. Juan es uno de los pocos jóvenes que le gusta cuidar de su familia y que cuenten con una vida digna, es por ello que él ha decidido solicitar un crédito de Q 2000.00 para la compra de cemento, cal, arena y así realizar la remodelación de su baño, pues ya se encuentra en muy mal estado y le preocupa que su familia no cuente con una condición  digna.
Juan sueña con construir  su casa e instalar un centro de internet  donde pueda proveer un poco más de ingreso y comprarse una moto para su movilización.
texts.en:
Juan, age 26, lives with his parents and siblings in the Department of Suchitepéquez. Juan is a young entrepreneur who works as a primary school teacher at a school in his community, contributing to its development. Through his labor, he earns enough money cover his university expenses.

Juan is one of those rare youths who likes to care for his family and see to it that they are able to lead respectable lives. That's why he's requesting this loan for Q2000.00, which he will use to purchase cement, lime, and sand and carry out a remodel on their bathroom. It's currently in very bad condition and he's concerned that it deprives his family of a dignified situation.

Juan's goal is to build his home and include an internet center where he can raise a little more money, eventually buying a motorbike for his transportation.

loans.use: buy supplies to remodel his family bathroom, which is in very poor condition

loans.name: Melissa Guadalupe

texts.es:
Trabajar no es impedimento para no estudiar, esta es la respuesta  que Melissa repite cada que le preguntan cómo hace para estudiar en la universidad  aun cuando de día trabaja.  Ella es consciente de que es un poco cansado y  se requiere de mucha disciplina, pero el obtener su título universitario en Marketing y Publicidad, vale cualquier esfuerzo.

Por esta razón, solicita un financiamiento para pagar su título universitario, el cual le ayudará a obtener mayores oportunidades de trabajo y con el que podrá iniciar una especialidad para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Working is not an impediment to studying. That is the answer that Melissa gives every time that she is asked how she is able to go to college when she still works during the day. She is aware that it is a little tiring and requires a lot of discipline, but getting her college degree in Marketing and Publicity is worth any sacrifice. 

For that reason, she is asking for a loan to pay for her college degree. This will help her to obtain more work opportunities and with it, she will be able to start a specialty to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for her college degree.

loans.name: Carlos Bismarck

texts.es:
El amor  hacia  la tecnología siempre ha estado presente en el corazón de Carlos, por eso cuando decidió  que estudiar en la universidad  no dudo inscribirse en ingeniería en sistemas, hoy se encuentra a un año de egresar. 

Por lo cual, solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora y pagar un curso de inglés. Esto le ayudará porque podrá realizar sus trabajos académicos con mayor eficacia y complementará su formación al hablar otro idioma. Cabe destacar, que Carlos planea realizar una maestria e iniciar un negocio de reparación de computadoras.
texts.en:
The love of technology has always been present in the heart of Carlos. That is why when he decided to go to college, he didn't think twice about majoring in computer science. Today he is a year away from finishing. 

Because of that, he is asking for a loan to buy a computer and pay for an English class. This will help him because he can do his academic work with more efficiency and will finish his training when he speaks a foreign language. It is worth noting that Carlos plans on getting a master's degree and starting a computer repair business.

loans.use: to buy a computer and to pay for an English class.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma is looking forward to the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well especially for the much needed land and seedbed preparations. She applied for a loan from the Cooperative in order to have enough supply of corn fertilizer. Elma hopes to save enough income for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more produce

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 50 years old and married. She lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur.

For the past 20 years, Lucena has been a farmer. She earns 35,500 PHP each cropping period and is a microfinance member of PMPC.

Lucena is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer.

In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is 71 years old, a widower, and lives in Talairon, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. He is living with his children, wherein he's taken care of.

Manuel operates a rice field that gives him quarterly income of PHP 35,000. He is also supported with a monthly pension.

He sign up for membership with Paglaum MPC and enjoys its benefits as a member.

Recently, he availed a loan of PHP 30,000 to pay for a medical check-up and purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to pay for a medical check-up and purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, she requested a loan to jump start her corn production. After several months, she was able to repay her loan. Teofila feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her farm. 

Teofila requested another loan, which she will use to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. She wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 56 years old and married with nine children.

Dolores works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

Dolores has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Dolores aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, eggs, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Santa Lucia Germania

texts.es: Germania, una señora que desde  hace 30 años atas se dedica a su negocio de tienda, Germania tiene  67 años de edad está casada con un señor que es chofer, estos esposos tiene 2 hijos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes, Germania solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de productos de tienda,asi como arroz, azucar, productos de aseo, confites y mas. Germania está contenta con su negocio y espera que sus clientes sigan visitando su tienda que para esto necesita estar bien variado en mercadería.
texts.en:
Germania has been running her shop business for 30 years. She is 57 years old and is married to a driver. This couple has 2 adult children who are independent. 

Germania is asking for this loan in order to invest it in buying products for her shop, such as rice, sugar, cleaning products and candy, among others. Germania is happy with her business and hopes that her customers will continue visiting her shop, which means her shop needs to have a good variety of products.

loans.use: to buy products for her shop.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 48 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Edna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, pancit, sugar, home care products and other groceries.

Edna has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, soy sauce, vinegar and other groceries.

In the future, Edna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, pancit, sugar, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 75 years old, married, and lives in Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental.

She owns and operates a stall in the local public market selling various garments, slippers, shoes and other things. She is a pensioner-member of Paglaum MPC and had enjoyed all services it offers to members like her.

Recently, she avails a loan to restock the store with dry goods to sell.

loans.use: to restock the store with dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester has always been enthusiastic about farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Blancia, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, and has good yields and earnings doing this type of work.

Recently she applied a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting.

Ester knew that she had to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season.

In the future, she hopes to buy a hauling truck for the easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Clarence

texts.en:
Clarence earns a living through her clothing sales. She is from Liloy, Zamboanga del Sur. For her capital needs, PMPC stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business with determination and her family as her inspiration. 

Clarence requested a loan, which she will use to purchase more clothing inventories to sell. She hopes to live comfortably and have her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is 52 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Visitacion is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

Visitacion has been in this business for 10 years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Youmiryn

texts.en:
Youmiryn is 30 years old and married with three children.

Youmiryn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Youmiryn has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Youmiryn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Zendie Rose

texts.en:
Zendie Rose is 30 years old with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Zendie Rose is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Zendie Rose has been in this business for five years and earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Felomena

texts.en:
Felomena is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Felomena is 50 years old now.

Felomena has a mat weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy nipa leaves and other materials needed for her business.

Felomena has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy nipa leaves and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 42 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child in school.

Judith is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Judith has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en: Candelaria is 83 years old, widowed and has seven adult children. She lives in Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. She is a pensioner-member of Paglaum MPC and had enjoyed all services offered to pensioners like her. PMPC to Candelaria is a blessing knowing she can always turn to the cooperative for everything she needs. Currently, she is requesting a loan of PHP 23,000 to purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance medicines

loans.name: Argie

texts.en: Argie believes education is a key to success in life. She wants to earn a degree and become a successful entrepreneur. Argie wants to help her family and her siblings finish their education as well. With the loan of PHP 7,658 she will be able to pay for her tuition and graduation costs. She is about to finish her course work but would need to fully pay the school fees. Argie sees herself to be in a position to help others in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tution and graduation costs

loans.name: Las Amazonas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS AMAZONAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ivone es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chompas, venta de dulces, venta de cotillones (accesorios para fiesta de cumpleaños), venta de ropa deportiva, venta de carne, venta de pasankalla (pipocas de maíz).

El crédito que sacarán beneficiará a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ivone es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa deportiva; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus papás hace varios años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa deportiva por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “LAS AMAZONAS” communal bank is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer. As part of the Focal Centre of Santiago II, the group is made up of nine members and is led by a board of directors, with Señora Ivone as the President. The businesses headed by the members are varied, but include: selling jumpers, candy, party accessories, sportswear, meat, and pasankalla (popcorn).

The loan will benefit small microbusinesses of the group where Señora Ivone is a member. She states that she joined Pro Mujer through a friend's invitation who is a client of the institution. Currently she has a business selling sportswear, and she says that she learnt this business from her parents several years ago.

The current loan will be used to increase her capital so that she can buy sportswear in bulk from the wholesalers in La Paz. She can then sell the merchandise on in her sales space. This way of working allows her to earn an income to support her family financially, as she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the healthcare and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy sportswear in bulk.

loans.name: Isam

texts.en:
Isam is a 21-year-old single man from Qabatiya, a small village near Jinan City in the West Bank. He is a worker in the construction sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

So Isam took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system and a water tank for heating water for the family house.

By taking this loan, Isam will be able to decrease the electricity expenses while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Isam’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes.

Isam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system and water tank for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Ceriaca

texts.en: Ceriaca makes good earning on her farming activities in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. This is how she supports her family and is able to send her children to school. She wants to increase her farm yield, especially because she has high cost of living when her children entered college.  Ceriaca approached Paglaum to borrow a loan to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this crop season.

loans.use: buy a knapsack insecticide sprayer

loans.name: Neciforo

texts.en:
Neciforo is 60 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is widowed with one child, now an adult. 

Neciforo earns his living from a service income of his own motorcycle transport for hire. He is also engaged in swine breeding.  Neciforo earns approximately PHP 15,000 each month. He also receives a monthly pension as his wife's survivor. 

Neciforo has requested a loan to be used in purchasing 10 heads of piglets and 10 sacks of feeds for his swine breeding activity. Neciforo has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for four years.  In the future, he hopes to expand his swine breeding business.

loans.use: buy piglets & feed

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 47 years old and lives in Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed and has one child, now at its school age. 

Teodora is engaged in a coconut and copra (dried coconut meat) buying and trading business. She's been in the business for 13 years already. She earns approximately PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She is also receiving a monthly pension as a surviving spouse. 

Teodora has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional coconut and copra for processing and resale. Teodora has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to become a major copra trader in the area.

loans.use: buy coconut & copra

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring and harvesting and earning income as well. Lilian has supported her husband doing this type of work.  

Like a farmer, Lilian has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knew she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. 

Recently, Lilian applied a loan to purchase rice seeds to have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.  Someday, Lilian hopes to purchase another rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: buy rice seeds

loans.name: Aminadab

texts.en:
Aminadab is 60 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married and has 5 children who are now at their adult age. 

Aminadab earns a living from service income as a welder and mechanic for PUV and sidecar repairs. He is also engaged in building grills and motorcab   bodies. He’s been in this business for 20 years. Aminadab earns an approximate amount of PHP 7,000 from these business and this amount is so helpful to meet his family needs.   

Aminadab has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stocks of metal sheets, steel bars and welding rods for his welding shop business. Aminadab has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  In the future, Aminadab hopes to expand his welding and motor repair shop business.

loans.use: buy metal working materials

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene landed at a right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet after she  went broke when her first business went bad.  PMPC to Arlene came as a rescue for lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she availed herself of another loan for the next crop season. She borrowed the loan for land and seedbed preparation.  

Arlene perseveres and always believes in reaching her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: pay for seedbed preparation

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is 52 years old, widowed, and lives in Talairon, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is a pensioner-member of Paglaum MPC and had enjoyed its various services. She had maintained her records of good standing without default payments. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase maintenance medicine.

loans.use: buy medicine

loans.name: Milagrose

texts.en:
Milagrose is 64 years old, widowed, and lives in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is supported with her monthly pension, aside from her monthly allotment from her children. She nurtures her membership with Paglaum MPC and maintains her record of loan repayments without default. 

Currently, Milagrose avails herself of a loan of PHP 10,000.00 to purchase maintenance medicine.

loans.use: buy medicine

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La señora tiene 63 años de edad y vive en la zona nor oeste de la ciudad, ella es soltera y tiene un único  hermano menor al que quiere entrañablemente quien estaba  gravemente enfermo.  un primer diagnóstico médico indicaba que su estado de salud era delicado y en las últimas 4 semanas estuvo en  la unidad de cuidados intensivos de una clínica privada con la esperanza de salvarle la vida, le recomendaron el inicio de quimioterapia, se le presentaron otras complicaciones neumológicas por un hongo intrahospitalario, paso a terapia intensiva, su tratamiento incluía medicamentos   muy costosos los cuales requirio cada semana para su aplicación. después de todo el tratamiento el señor falleció, por tal motivo ella y su familia solicitan el préstamo están para pagar los gastos que fueron incurridos durante su tratamiento y su internación ya que estos son muy elevados y no cuneta con los recursos necesarios para cubrirlos.
texts.en:
This woman is 63 years old and lives in the north-west zone of the city. She is single and had one younger brother who she loved deeply. He became gravely ill and the preliminarily medical diagnosis showed that his health was delicate. For four weeks he was in the intensive care unit of a private clinic with hope of saving his life. Chemotherapy was recommended at first but while he was in the hospital other lung complications caused by fungus set in. He was given intensive therapy and his treatment included very expensive drugs which he needed each week. In spite of all this treatment the man died.

For these reasons the woman and her family are requesting this loan to pay the expenses from his treatment and his hospitalization as they are costly and they don't have the resources to cover them.

loans.use: to pay the expenses of her deceased brother's hospitalization and treatment which were quite expensive.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Arlene works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Arlene is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business for her motorcycle transport business.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 52 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Avelina works very hard to provide for them.

Avelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like school supplies, home product care, and other groceries.

Avelina has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Avelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like school supplies, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is a widowed woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Bernardita is 49 years old and all of her children are in school.

Bernardita has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Bernardita requested a PHP 17000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell.

Bernardita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Bernardita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell

loans.name: Anacorita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Anacorita works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. Anacorita is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Anacorita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is 32 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Carmela works very hard to provide for them.

Carmela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care, ando other groceries.

Carmela has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Carmela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care, ando other groceries

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Lucy works hard to support her family.  She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  

Lucy is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to  buy more boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Lucy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Norma is 45 years old and has two children who are in school.

Norma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Norma has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 39-year-old married woman with four children.  She lives in a rural community outside of Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.  She owns and operates a small general store selling a variety of food items. She has been doing this for two years.

Mary requested a loan to buys goods such as rice, canned food, biscuits and soft drinks to assist her run the business. She plan to use her profit to help cover for her family's weekly expenses and also meets her children's school fees. 

Mary joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
A $ 600 loan is offered to Rita to improve her business.

She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar and rice.

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2013, with her own capital of $170.

She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil and other items to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 60 years old and single with eight children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Corazon runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Corazon has been in this business for 36 years.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Cleofas

texts.en: Cleofas signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari (variety store) business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Cleofa wasi able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took out a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Tita

texts.en: Tita learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Tipan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, she tried her luck and borrowed money to start corn production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Tita feels she owes her good fortune to the cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used to start her business. Recently, she took out a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Tita wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn to neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is 81 years old, widowed and lives in Layawan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is a pensioner-member of Paglaum MPC. She maintains her records of good standing by paying her loans on time without defaults. Recently, she took out a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance medicines

loans.name: Dorina

texts.en: Dorina is a married woman and a mother of two young children ages two and seven from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than seven years now. She also runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items in her place such as toiletries, seasoning, condiments and canned food. Dorina is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, boat engine, noodles, canned goods, shampoo, bath soap, chocolate drink and toothpaste. Through this, Dorina will be able to improve her inventory and will not run out of stock for her store. She dreamed of seeing her children be successful in their studies.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, boat engine, noodles, canned goods, shampoo, bath soap, chocolate drink and toothpaste

loans.name: Dailen

texts.en:
Dailen is 40 years old and has four children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Dailen is in the agricultural business, farming root crops in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She has been farming root crops for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Dailen would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs and charcoal retailing businesses.

Concepcion is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to customers.

Concepcion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.
